commit_message:
Nova libvirt Xtreemfs driver.

Driver used in conjunction with cinder when configured to use
XtreemFS, it work similarly to nfs and GlusterFS drivers.

Configuration option added: xtreemfs_mount_point_base

Change-Id: I630a8ff79f099b969eaad27465db6f10da0454fd
blueprint: xtreemfs-support
DocImpact

commit_message:
local storage volume and store incremental snapshots in other storage

Implementation of Island volume driver. This will allow to create volume
in local storage and store incremental snapshots in other storage, such
as Swift,NFS,GlusterFS.

WIP

Implements: bp local-storage-volume

Change-Id: I4aa41c87f203468284993e09d05cdd83e6f7d83e

subject: Qpid belongs in test-requirements
messages:
[{'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-07-23 18:14:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

AFAIK Qpid could be used instead of RabbitMQ for RPC, so, why moving only it to test-requires.txt?'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-07-23 18:17:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

qpid is great, but is an optional requirement, not a required requirement.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-23 18:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/45/38345/1/check/gate-requirements-install/298 : SUCCESS in 7m 16s
'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-23 18:19:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-07-23 20:44:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Russell: I think we should be doing one or the other. Presently, we have zeromq, redis, and mysql-python in test-requirements.txt. Monty's suggestion was to remove Qpid and other optional dependencies from requirements.txt. Yes, that would also apply to kazoo and should really apply to Kombu as well."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-23 21:06:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I'm just looking for clarification between the two files, because this change confuses the issue for me."}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2013-07-24 15:04:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Do we need a 'suggests' file? Most of the things in the testing-requirements.txt file are very specific to testing. These are optional dependencies that packagers might desire to make 'suggested' dependencies."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-01 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-01 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

Qpid belongs in test-requirements

We want to test qpid, but not require it for installation.

Change-Id: I6681aa1b86a51d4666d7e151d77f91b9bed9533f

commit_message:
Use shunit2 for integration tests

Update the shell script that runs the integration tests to
use shunit2, to provide assertion functions and the ability
to run all of the tests even if some of them fail.

Sample output for a test run can be found at:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/41125/

Change-Id: Ib8c3609531b5a3efbab914c91039a8af69f86e3e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-05-31 15:38:22.000000000', 'message': "Don't raise Timeout on no-matchmaker results

We were raising a Timeout when no matchmaker results
were returned. While arguably legitimate (especially with
'call'), there are places in the code where this may
not be caught (or cared about) on 'cast'.

When sending a cast, we'll simply fail to deliver the message
and log a warning. Using call() will still raise a Timeout.

This bug would generally surface when there were no consumers
for a topic (in the view of the selected matchmaker)

Fixes bug 1186310

Change-Id: I3c351a4ca921aa804caeaf0751351e036268a3bb
"}, {'created': '2013-06-14 18:03:23.000000000', 'message': "Don't raise Timeout on no-matchmaker results

We were raising a Timeout when no matchmaker results
were returned. While arguably legitimate (especially with
'call'), there are places in the code where this may
not be caught (or cared about) on 'cast'.

When sending a cast, we'll simply fail to deliver the message
and log a warning. Using call() will still raise a Timeout.

This bug would generally surface when there were no consumers
for a topic (in the view of the selected matchmaker)

Fixes bug 1186310

Change-Id: I3c351a4ca921aa804caeaf0751351e036268a3bb
"}, {'created': '2013-07-09 21:16:06.000000000', 'message': "Don't raise Timeout on no-matchmaker results

We were raising a Timeout when no matchmaker results
were returned. While arguably legitimate (especially with
'call'), there are places in the code where this may
not be caught (or cared about) on 'cast'.

When sending a cast, we'll simply fail to deliver the message
and log a warning. Using call() will still raise a Timeout.

This bug would generally surface when there were no consumers
for a topic (in the view of the selected matchmaker)

Fixes bug 1186310

Change-Id: I3c351a4ca921aa804caeaf0751351e036268a3bb
"}]
commit_message:
Don't raise Timeout on no-matchmaker results

We were raising a Timeout when no matchmaker results
were returned. While arguably legitimate (especially with
'call'), there are places in the code where this may
not be caught (or cared about) on 'cast'.

When sending a cast, we'll simply fail to deliver the message
and log a warning. Using call() will still raise a Timeout.

This bug would generally surface when there were no consumers
for a topic (in the view of the selected matchmaker)

Fixes bug 1186310

Change-Id: I3c351a4ca921aa804caeaf0751351e036268a3bb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-04 16:13:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add XtreemFS volume driver

This driver enables use of XtreemFS in a similar fashion
as the NFS and GlusterFS driver. It supports basic volume operations,
and like NFS, does not support snapshot/clone.

To enable, set volume_driver to
cinder.volume.drivers.xtreemfs.XtreemfsDriver

Note that this requires a Nova libvirt Xtreemfs driver
that is commited in another review.

Configuration options added: xtreemfs_shares_config,
xtreemfs_mount_point_base, xtreemfs_disk_util, and
xtreemfs_sparsed_volumes.

Change-Id: Ic2e89294bc0757a6685a8042ec9c563b37689c12
blueprint: bp/xtreemfs-support
'}, {'created': '2013-06-05 13:56:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add XtreemFS volume driver

commit_message:
Add XtreemFS volume driver

This driver enables use of XtreemFS in a similar fashion
as the NFS and GlusterFS driver. It supports basic volume operations,
and like NFS, does not support snapshot/clone.

To enable, set volume_driver to
cinder.volume.drivers.xtreemfs.XtreemfsDriver

Note that this requires a Nova libvirt Xtreemfs driver
that is commited in review (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/31668/).

Configuration options added: xtreemfs_shares_config,
xtreemfs_mount_point_base and xtreemfs_sparsed_volumes.

Change-Id: Ic2e89294bc0757a6685a8042ec9c563b37689c12
blueprint: xtreemfs-support

commit_message:
Remove static unused data from libvirt capabilities

Compute node capabilities are currently periodically sent to all the
schedulers, but much of the data in the capabilities cannot change
without nova-compute restarting and is already stored in the database.
So instead of periodically sending data the scheduler already knows
about, don't send that data.

Removes:
* vcpus
* vcpus_used
* cpu_info
* hypervisor_type
* hypervisor_version

Also clarify related docstrings

Change-Id: Id4eb41cbdd85c0c3ee74bad9a51fd60a3a81c069

In my previous experience, it was an issue.
Ops used wrong tenant id several times.'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-24 11:24:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Even if this checks adds a round trip to keystone only for a small set of API calls, this still adds overhead we don't want to add.

Also:
- The issue pertains the admin context only. The effect is that unusable resources are generated, which in most cases do not even waste resources. So I guess it is not that serious to require us to do this kind of operation, which as far as I know, is not performed in any other openstack project.
- This tightens Neutron & Keystone, whereas the general approach is to keep them as separate as possible.

I am not sure we should merge it, because this would set a precedent allowing other contributors to add interactions between neutron and other openstack services."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-07-24 19:39:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

This bug was previously marked invalid as the current behavior is expected and correct.  The fix may seems straight forward to validate against Keystone but there are considerations that have been pointed out in the other reviews and few that haven't (there are deployments that don't leverage keystone).

Given the impact of this change, it should also be done via the blueprint process.  Feel free to start a discussion on mailing list."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-24 22:11:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Just to add some pedatry to the discussion, I did not point out deployments without keystone because this patch does the keystone client request only if auth_strategy is keystone.

But I agree with all that markmcclain said.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-01 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

commit_message:
validate tenant id which maybe invalid

Admin is allowed to create and update resources for the other tenants.
Previously the tenant id was not checked whether it exists or not.
Affected commands are the following. floatingip-create, lb-member-create,
lb-pool-create, lb-vip-create, net-create, port-create, security-group-create,
security-group-rule-create, subnet-create and quota-update.

Fixes bug 1200585

Change-Id: Ia64285468beab478dee9b9b3d6fbb656ddd751f3

commit_message:
Skip memcache related tests when being unavailable

When memcached is not running, data can still be stored
in memcache but not retrieved anymore, which causes
test suite failures. Skip those tests that expect consistency
from the memcache layer when memcache is not configured.

Also add python-memcached to the test-requirements to be
able to run those tests.

Change-Id: Ifae14e655fdee8a4b74dbed4daad0bf38c9595e1

What is your intention with this review? As it stands, it won't get merged, so either abandon it, or justify why you think it needs to get merged"}, {'account_id': 7186, 'date': '2013-07-09 12:58:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@ayoung: the idea is to add the support for extra kwargs when calling the methods for creating and updating users in keystone v3 API. It is already present for v2. 
It is based on Dolph Mathews' suggestion here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-keystoneclient/+bug/1047867/comments/5

I have a patch on python-openstackclient that relies on these extra arguments, I am waiting for this submission to pass before sending it in.

If you need more explanations about it feel free to ask."}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2013-07-25 01:44:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The problem is that there is no advantage to adding these to keystoneclient. If you look at CrudManager anything that gets passed through there will either be used for the url or sent to the database which is a bad thing to allow for arbitrary values. 

What do you need for openstack-client? How would this help in any way? Which review?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-01 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-08-01 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

keystone user-update --extra key1:value1 --extra key2:value2 ... user
The operations user-update and user-create are supported.

commit_message:
Support for user extra metadata in keystone v3 client library

This adds the support for arbitrary extra arguments when creating or updating
a user with keystone's v3 API. This is required before adding the
functionality to the generic python openstack client library.

necessary for #1047867.

Change-Id: Ie10e203025a0d9f647e458ad940c050f5e3275af

commit_message:
Add glance-cache-cleaner and glance-cache-pruner

* glance::cache::cleaner: Installs a cron job to remove stalled and
  invalid cached images.
* glance::cache::pruner: Installs a cron job to keep the image cache
  at or below the maximum cache size.

Change-Id: I99cb1809446f1a1126454ff5fa5bdceb8044ee28

'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-07-31 03:24:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I thought about it and you are right in saying that we need to remove $host from $allowed_hosts, otherwise the remaining "non-duplicated" hosts in $allowed_hosts won't be authorized.

In fact, which resources are duplicated? database_user and database_grant? Can we wrap them in an "if defined" block? This would allow us to pass $allowed_hosts unchanged to glance::db::mysql::host_access and still avoid the duplicated resources.'}, {'account_id': 1607, 'date': '2013-07-31 04:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Yes, It need to remove $host from $allowed_hosts.  

In fact, Database_user is duplicated.
For example:
err: Could not retrieve catalog from remote server: Error 400 on SERVER: Duplicate declaration: Database_user[glance@127.0.0.1] is already declared; cannot redeclare at /etc/puppet/modules/production/glance/manifests/db/mysql/host_access.pp:9 

What do you think about my patch2?'}, {'account_id': 1607, 'date': '2013-07-31 08:14:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Maybe it's not a good way to hack glance::db::mysql::host_access for wrapping database_user and database_grant to do these logic, as it's a lower define for adding new db hosts. It's good to keep it simple without any conditional statement. 

So I'd like to add conditional statement in higher class glance::db::mysql, evaluate $real_allowed_hosts  and pass it to glance::db::mysql::host_access.

A more better way, just like Dan says: we really should build something called openstack_common where we can just store all of the reusable bits like this so that we don't have to have the same refactors across multiple modules."}, {'account_id': 1607, 'date': '2013-07-31 08:15:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-31 08:18:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/63/39263/4/check/gate-puppet-glance-puppet-unit-3.1/96 : SUCCESS in 49s
'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-07-31 21:09:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

We should add a test to ensure Puppet does not explode when trying to provide an $allowed_hosts which is identical to $host.

Otherwise, due to the nature of the Puppet language, I don't see how this version can be improved further."}, {'account_id': 2265, 'date': '2013-07-31 21:12:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

[{'created': '2013-07-30 11:14:02.000000000', 'message': 'Update allowed_hosts conditional statement

In the origin glance::db::mysql, if the value of $allowed_hosts
contains or equals to $host, then puppet will complain duplicate
declaration error. This patch is aim to update the allowed_hosts
conditonal statement in glance::db::mysql:

   - If $allowed_hosts is array and $host in $allowed_hosts, pass;
   - elsif $allowed_hosts is string and equivalent to $host, pass;
   - elsif $allowed_hosts is undef, pass;
   - else run glance::db::mysql::host_access

Fix bug 1206444

commit_message:
Update allowed_hosts conditional statement

In the origin glance::db::mysql, if the value of $allowed_hosts
contains or equals to $host, then puppet will complain duplicate
declaration error. This patch is aim to update the allowed_hosts
conditonal statement in glance::db::mysql.

There are two cases to pass $allowed_hosts to $real_allowed_hosts:

   - If $allowed_hosts is array,then remove $host from $allowed_hosts;
   - elsif $allowed_hosts is string and not equivalent to $host;

At last, if $real_allowed_hosts is not undef, then run
glance::db::mysql::host_access

Fix bug 1206444

Change-Id: Ic70aaaec493195c7277782abb87469f9809e5baa

commit_message:
update xen/vmware virt drivers not to hit db directly

This change replaces calls to compute api with calls to
conductor api updated with a 'compute_reboot' function.

Fix for bug 1177993

Conflicts:

	nova/conductor/manager.py
	nova/conductor/rpcapi.py
	nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I9aefba95cce29c1486fdfb25008f8da9ece1c19b

commit_message:
PLUMgrid plugin v2

This commit implements blueprint plumgrid-plugin-v2

Includes PLUMlib Library
Fake PLUMLib library for Unit Tests
Remove the use of topologies
Includes IOVISOR VIF driver
Implements External Networks

Change-Id: I8ba90862e5a416d04d3327b46fcb0f6f3fa65248

commit_message:
Add support for API message localization

Using the lazy gettext functionality from oslo gettextutils,
it is possible to use the Accept-Language header to translate
an exception message to the user requested locale and return
that translation from the API.

Implements bp user-locale-api

Change-Id: I7041e41359a39de461a46024df1105763fe9b94c
Co-authored-by: Mathew Odden <mrodden@us.ibm.com>
Co-authored-by: Ben Nemec <openstack@nemebean.com>

commit_message:
Fix 'undefined symbol conn' error

Use self.conn, not conn.

Fixes LP Bug #1188619

commit_message:
Added changes to accommodate rename of incubator.

Made changes to documentation and scripts to accommodate the changes
required as part of moving the module incubator from stackforge to
openstack.

Change-Id: I41cc86d2792c6e8f9d2f01936f252daf4d407bc9

commit_message:
Always return a list from VolumeTableMixIn._get*

Returning None from these methods leads to TypeError
(None is not iterable)

Fixes: bug #1182075
Change-Id: Ia5f5fe78669bbaed599b7dd5cae1beb69bde7796
(cherry picked from commit decee66cb412cafecddc581cd8f229e77a9c6f1a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 00:32:12.000000000', 'message': "Increase timeout period for clone volume.

Current timeout value for clone volume in the
SolidFire driver is 20 seconds, this is fine
in many cases however there seems to be a
number of customers doing clones of
volumes >= 400G.

A populated 400G volume is taking upwards of
35 seconds to clone in some cases resulting in failure.

There's no reason not to bump this timeout value up
significantly to a worst case scenario (ie multi-terrabyte volume).

Fixes bug: 1202007

Change-Id: I98c399f5d647e14f031018f7fc1cc43bb0d94c84
(cherry picked from commit 9ce7cdbaeb73031d841cb0943ca1812b149d1c19)
"}]
commit_message:
Increase timeout period for clone volume.

Current timeout value for clone volume in the
SolidFire driver is 20 seconds, this is fine
in many cases however there seems to be a
number of customers doing clones of
volumes >= 400G.

A populated 400G volume is taking upwards of
35 seconds to clone in some cases resulting in failure.

There's no reason not to bump this timeout value up
significantly to a worst case scenario (ie multi-terrabyte volume).

Fixes bug: 1202007

Change-Id: I98c399f5d647e14f031018f7fc1cc43bb0d94c84
(cherry picked from commit 9ce7cdbaeb73031d841cb0943ca1812b149d1c19)

commit_message:
Correct status code and response for quota_sets API v3

* Modify the response of update quota include 'id' that is same
with show quota.
* Change the status code of delete to 204.
* The request body of update have needn't 'tenant_id' and 'id', so remove them
from NON_QUOTA_KEYS.

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

Change-Id: Id5bb149a911fa992a5cd374a3666ebfa976ec2c3

'/os-hypervisors/[filters]/servers'

Change it as:
'/os-hypervisors/[hypervisor id]/servers'
And tt will return all the servers on the specific hypervisor.

commit_message:
Fix v3 hypervisor extension servers action follow REST principles

The orignial hypervisor servers action as below:
'/os-hypervisors/[filters]/servers'

Change it as:
'/os-hypervisors/[hypervisor id]/servers'
And tt will return all the servers on the specific hypervisor.

Partially implements: bp v3-api-extension-versioning

DocImpact

Change-Id: I6c252372af67eda79f670199deb6592c02603c33

'}, {'created': '2013-08-01 01:37:36.000000000', 'message': 'Remove wsme validate decorator from API

The @validate decorator is here to make migration from TGWebServices

Change-Id: I9ee89c474423946a9e43f6e5dd4caa988dae5f9c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove wsme validate decorator from API

remove validate as it completely replaced by wsexpose

The @validate decorator is here to make migration from TGWebServices
easy, and should be used only when porting code from it.

Change-Id: I9ee89c474423946a9e43f6e5dd4caa988dae5f9c

commit_message:
Sorted list firstly when assert equal two lists

Fixes bug 1206841
The test_get_service_by_host_name failed sometimes because of
MismatchError, but those two list are equal eventually, it's a
false positive error just because these two lists are not sorted,
so sorted them before assertEqual.

Change-Id: I9b5574bb8d55310ffcb0115628f39b678a1c52bd

commit_message:
Modify is_valid_mac() for support unicode strings

Because an address can be used as <id> in ports REST API
we need also validation for mac in unicode strings.

Missing tests for is_valid_mac() added.

Change-Id: I7207c0fb9c1c2c1720337c1a7568f6b9cb8ea3c3

commit_message:
Thorough edit of installation chapter.

Moved all procedures into <orderedlist> tags. Corrected grammatical errors. Added descriptive tags (e.g. <filename>). Made chapter titles consistent. Updated from quantum to neutron (to deal with upstream changes already made).

Change-Id: Ib729ba9a2c929ab883489e073fd347eced7cbcf6

commit_message:
Ensure $TMP_BUILD_DIR is actually created.

Previously if mktemp failed in function mk_build_dir, die was not
called.  The check for the exit code was actually checking that the
previous export statement completed successfully, not the call to
mktemp.

Change-Id: I477a2ce75c87c8167883ce7aa342e93c40770e29

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-19 22:25:29.000000000', 'message': "Make flavors is_public option actually work

When you create a flavor, you can set an is_public flag to be True or
False.  It is True by default.  When False, the intention is that the
flavor is only accessible by an admin, unless you use the flavor_access
API extension to grant access to specific tenants.

Unfortunately, the only place in the code where this was being enforced
was when listing flavors through the API.  It would filter out the
non-public ones for a non-admin.  Otherwise, the flavor was accessible.
You could get the details, and you could boot an instance with it, if
you figured out a valid flavor ID.

This patch adds enforcement down in the db layer.  It also fixes one
place in the API where the context wasn't passed down to enable the
enforcement to happen.

Fix bug 1194093.

(cherry picked from commit b65d506a5f9d9b2b20777a9aceb44a8ffed6a5de)

Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/flavor_access.py
	nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/flavormanage.py

When you create a flavor, you can set an is_public flag to be True or
False.  It is True by default.  When False, the intention is that the
flavor is only accessible by an admin, unless you use the flavor_access
API extension to grant access to specific tenants.

Unfortunately, the only place in the code where this was being enforced
was when listing flavors through the API.  It would filter out the
non-public ones for a non-admin.  Otherwise, the flavor was accessible.
You could get the details, and you could boot an instance with it, if
you figured out a valid flavor ID.

This patch adds enforcement down in the db layer.  It also fixes one
place in the API where the context wasn't passed down to enable the
enforcement to happen.

commit_message:
Make flavors is_public option actually work

When you create a flavor, you can set an is_public flag to be True or
False.  It is True by default.  When False, the intention is that the
flavor is only accessible by an admin, unless you use the flavor_access
API extension to grant access to specific tenants.

Unfortunately, the only place in the code where this was being enforced
was when listing flavors through the API.  It would filter out the
non-public ones for a non-admin.  Otherwise, the flavor was accessible.
You could get the details, and you could boot an instance with it, if
you figured out a valid flavor ID.

This patch adds enforcement down in the db layer.  It also fixes one
place in the API where the context wasn't passed down to enable the
enforcement to happen.

Fix bug 1194093.

(cherry picked from commit b65d506a5f9d9b2b20777a9aceb44a8ffed6a5de)

Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/flavor_access.py
	nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/flavormanage.py
	nova/api/openstack/compute/flavors.py
	nova/compute/api.py
	nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavor_access.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavor_disabled.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavor_manage.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavor_rxtx.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavor_swap.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_flavorextradata.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/test_flavors.py
	nova/tests/db/test_db_api.py

Change-Id: I5b37fa0bb19683fe1642fd81222547d4a317054e

'}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2013-08-01 00:36:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

lgtm, just wondering if we could instead just use elements/dib-run-parts/root.d/dib-run-parts (or move dib-run-parts into dib/bin where it can be used), just a thought we would then gain profiling but I'm not sure if using a script from an element is a good idea from a dependency point of view, I'd be interested in hearing other views."}, {'account_id': 2674, 'date': '2013-08-01 00:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Using elements/dib-run-parts/root.d/dib-run-parts directly would mean invoking it from run_d() as "/bin/bash ../elements/dib-run-parts/root.d/dib-run-parts", which looked kind of messy to me (or fragile if that element ever changed substantially).

I did experiment with symlinking bin/dib-run-parts to elements/dib-run-parts/root.d/dib-run-parts, then invoking as "dib-run-parts ${TMP_HOOKS_PATH}/$1.d", but that requires marking elements/dib-run-parts/root.d/dib-run-parts executable. This in turn causes dib-run-parts in run_d() to invoke elements/dib-run-parts/root.d/dib-run-parts along with the regular hook scripts that we actually want to run in $TMP_HOOKS_PATH.  This invocation is undesirable and nonsensical, and in any case causes disk-image-create to terminate (invoking dib-image-create with no args fails).

I *didn't* try moving elements/dib-run-parts/root.d/dib-run-parts to bin/dib-run-parts, then updating elements/dib-run-parts/root.d/90-base-dib-run-parts to install $SCRIPT_HOME/dib-run-parts instead of $home/dib-run-parts, as that also seemed kind of messy to me (elements requiring "non element" code).  But I'll happily defer to others' wisdom of course :)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-08-01 00:36:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Also Note : when this is merged, we'll also have the change the step on devtest.md where PATH is appended."}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2013-08-01 00:36:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

[{'created': '2013-08-01 00:36:36.000000000', 'message': "Enable running disk-image-create on SUSE Linux

- Ensures /sbin and friends are in $PATH when invoked (without this,
  various sudo invocations fail in exciting ways).
- Use dib-run-parts in lib/common-functions instead of run-parts
  (neither SLES nor openSUSE ship run-parts).
- Ensure dib-run-parts doesn't descend into subdirectories (same
  behaviour as run-parts).
- Move dib-run-parts from root.d to bin (cleaner, consistent with
  other elements with separate bin scripts).
- Tested by building Ubuntu image on openSUSE 12.3.
- Note: this doesn't add support for creating SUSE images, it just
  lets you run disk-image-create on SUSE-based distros.

Change-Id: I906c6bc3cf51cdf2c4415adeae1ca250faac25e1

commit_message:
Enable running disk-image-create on SUSE Linux

- Ensures /sbin and friends are in $PATH when invoked (without this,
  various sudo invocations fail in exciting ways).
- Use dib-run-parts in lib/common-functions instead of run-parts
  (neither SLES nor openSUSE ship run-parts).
- Ensure dib-run-parts doesn't descend into subdirectories (same
  behaviour as run-parts).
- Move dib-run-parts from root.d to bin (cleaner, consistent with
  other elements with separate bin scripts).
- Tested by building Ubuntu image on openSUSE 12.3.
- Note: this doesn't add support for creating SUSE images, it just
  lets you run disk-image-create on SUSE-based distros.

Change-Id: I906c6bc3cf51cdf2c4415adeae1ca250faac25e1

commit_message:
Add skip_pip_install to setup.cfg

The envvar SKIP_PIP_INSTALL isn't enough in all cases. Add the ability
to configure this in the config file.

Change-Id: Ic84bd6df52d2b96bf4afcaacd9c8b6fee26e9840

commit_message:
Remove password auth from pyrax

Remove password auth from pyrax to conform with
the changes going through the engine regarding
not using a password.

blueprint pyrax-token-auth
Change-Id: I4ecc43d138f7cd71d41a7a3cd8ee29a821065383

commit_message:
Fix Hacking 0.6 warnings

This patch fixes missing License headers, License header mismatches
and locals() being used in string formatting operations.

Change-Id: I721700fda746e78d36d29d0ed64bfeab61755fb3

commit_message:
Avoid performing extra query for fetching port security binding

Bug 1201957

Add a relationship performing eager load in Port and Network
models, thus preventing the 'extend' function from performing
an extra database query.
Also fixes a comment in securitygroups_db.py

Change-Id: If0f0277191884aab4dcb1ee36826df7f7d66a8fa

commit_message:
Fix tempest logging configuration

This commit will correctly set the tempest output logging to dump
all of tempest logs into a tempest.log file in
$DEST/tempest/tempest.log. This will also fix the logging for
tempest in the gate so it will no longer print every log message on
the console.

Fixes bug 1207066

Change-Id: I91f2ee781c4a7a18c561ea3e3b26832b97431464

[{'created': '2013-07-26 19:34:57.000000000', 'message': 'BaseException.message is deprecated since Python 2.6

PEP 352 deprecated the message attribute of the BaseException class.
Using the message attribute will result in warnings like this:

DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6

Using unicode(exc) is the suggested replacement.

Change-Id: Ibf3c56e4baa6ad83e2b95a948787e9d02cf074d4
'}, {'created': '2013-07-26 20:22:49.000000000', 'message': 'BaseException.message is deprecated since Python 2.6

PEP 352 deprecated the message attribute of the BaseException class.
Using the message attribute will result in warnings like this:

DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6

Using unicode(exc) is the suggested replacement.

Change-Id: Ibf3c56e4baa6ad83e2b95a948787e9d02cf074d4
'}]
commit_message:
BaseException.message is deprecated since Python 2.6

PEP 352 deprecated the message attribute of the BaseException class.
Using the message attribute will result in warnings like this:

DeprecationWarning: BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6

Using unicode(exc) is the suggested replacement.

Change-Id: Ibf3c56e4baa6ad83e2b95a948787e9d02cf074d4

commit_message:
Move the wait for libvirt to be ready

setup-network should have been inserted after this wait, as it
uses libvirt.

Change-Id: Ib8d995145c04bc96211593e552a8810359a308fe

commit_message:
Remove tenant round 1 - global options

Change the global auth options to use 'project', leave the original
tenant options in place but silent for compatability with the existing
project CLI auth options.  This is the only compatibility for tenant
usage in this changeover.

Change-Id: I3cce6e552f18822cc9f445ec5f301b0f5d9003f8

it isn't loaded and no monitoring takes place.

commit_message:
Add New Relic application monitoring

This addition allows the New Relic Python agent to monitor
Barbican if New Relic is installed. If New Relic isn't installed,
it isn't loaded and no monitoring takes place.

Change-Id: I10093a93961260ef2ec310b6660caf24ea16ee56

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-30 20:54:44.000000000', 'message': "Add tox job for serial testr

This commit adds a new tox job to run tempest using testr serially.
This is intended to be used for development as an alternative to
using nose while we are debugging race conditions with parallel testr.
This commit also adds another wrapper shell script so that we can run
this tox job with the colorizer script and print the slowest tests at
the end.

Optionally if you'd like to run a subset of tempest (not what runs in
the gate) you can directly call tools/pretty_tox_serial.sh with the
regex filter as the arguments.

Change-Id: I6c69bc25ebaef7df1e2389ea2c7e0ef4ca5ec2aa
"}]
commit_message:
Add tox job for serial testr

This commit adds a new tox job to run tempest using testr serially.
This is intended to be used for development as an alternative to
using nose while we are debugging race conditions with parallel testr.
This commit also adds another wrapper shell script so that we can run
this tox job with the colorizer script and print the slowest tests at
the end.

Optionally if you'd like to run a subset of tempest (not what runs in
the gate) you can directly call tools/pretty_tox_serial.sh with the
regex filter as the arguments.

Change-Id: I6c69bc25ebaef7df1e2389ea2c7e0ef4ca5ec2aa

add lib/infra

move the infrastructure projects to a dedicated lib/infra, which
gives us access to this during grenade upgrade tests.

Change-Id: I1e832792b61d41ad290b4b2ab26fe664e710cebd

David, wrt:

> ...because eventlet's wsgi restricts headers too... 

Actually, the header that caused our grief had been added by middleware...which is why wsgi did not pick up the size issue.

I truncated the header name as suggested (arguably, I should not because it's not necessarily an x-blah-meta- item; but it keeps the message short).

As requested, for the x-blah-meta- checks, I made the messages more helpful. For the name too long check, I did *not* truncate the name since its nice to see exactly which name is too long."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-24 13:46:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

sent because old client code / curl has trouble sending blank
content-type headers.

Change-Id: Ie65ddf8993a19ea74e0b85a2ae56da84a617c19d
'}, {'created': '2013-07-30 22:17:56.000000000', 'message': 'Tell swift to figure out content type

'}]
commit_message:
Tell swift to figure out content type

Be able to tell swift to figure out the content-type even if it is
sent because old client code / curl has trouble sending blank
content-type headers.

Change-Id: Ie65ddf8993a19ea74e0b85a2ae56da84a617c19d

commit_message:
Prompted error message is not correct for PortNotFound

When deleting a non-existing port, the error message would be
"Port XXXX could not be found on network None" for some plugins.
"network None" is not correct enough here.

Fixes bug #1203631

Change-Id: Ie5d1ec99a2726ff3fec07f83f83a12d24613ae57

commit_message:
Update book files contain releaseinfo metadata to indicate master branch.

Changed to master for consistency with the Github branch name,
though it'll still publish to /trunk/. Feel free to discuss.

Change-Id: I78ed6fb9df9e1d770581ea54a53d98b37e1a5ec8

commit_message:
Added docs and made template filename variable

Changed how jinja ENV is created
Added docstrings to functions in template.py
Renamed _location_types private attribute of
 SingleInstanceConfigTemplate to _config_paths
SingleInstanceConfigTemplate constructor now uses filename based on
 service type
SingleInstanceConfigTemplate render method now returns the result
Tests updated to use new style of render method
mysql.config.template duplicated to percona.config.template

implements blueprint redis-servicetype

Change-Id: Id9317b560236d5d4967b888d0dc3a4135f1822dc

The fact that this bug crept in makes me wonder whether test coverage is sufficient, so how about adding a test :P ?"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-24 21:25:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is technically not a bug, but a refactoring.
The duplicate key is something that can be hardly tested.
The dict static initializer will just use the first instance of the key.

We might want to add unit tests that validate nvp resources are created for db mapping, but that would heavily depend either on the fake api client, or on widespread mocking.

I assume the idea of adding these unit tests across the board in a different patch is to be ruled out?'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-07-24 23:01:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

IMO it's fine if you want to address the testing issue separately. commit_message:
Create peer router port in appropriate port driver function

Bug 1204288

Removes peer port creation from add_router_interface.
Also fixes port_drivers dict which had a duplicate key.
In addition clears attachment on the NVP logical switch part
being paired with the logical router port before plugging
the patch attachment.

Change-Id: I336b29bdf017b2d34d97412fbe034845fe314fc7

commit_message:
Don't deallocate network if destroy time out

Fixes bug #1169057
Sames as bug 1180178, if libvirt returns time out error during destroy
an instance, we also can't deallocate the network of the instance,
otherwise the fixed ip of it may be re-used by another new instance,
and resulted in the new instance can't be accessed by the fixed ip.

Change-Id: I04dfd21bb1b7168abc71f39e836126a11dad6d8d
(cherry picked from commit d925044e09509495e7474d5f625bbd45d8985afa)

commit_message:
Adds test for include_claimed flag

This patch set adds test to verify that claimed messages are returned
or not, depending on the include_claimed flag.

Change-Id: I06f85b7bf78db241cbf0a2d85beac3972f64c9d0
Tests: bug #1202430

commit_message:
Fix for bad content inside Resources element

In validate_template check if we have a dict before we try to
get 'Type'. We also need to check the response back from
validate_template to see if there are any 'Error'(s) and present
that back to the user.

Fixes LP# 1204157

Change-Id: I0f636a6a84f6afc9a0aff3089e2bd13a8f88a470

commit_message:
add oslo.* to the projects list

We want to add oslo.* into the gating process, so git versions of
the libraries can be tested against the rest of OpenStack, and
that those parts of oslo can be tested against the gate. This is
a prereq of devstack changes we want to land to test fully against
global requirements.

Change-Id: Ib9abf6c9207c27d1e74726196f1bd19712901db7

commit_message:
Fix flavor_access extension follow API V3 rules

* Add decorator expected_errors
* Correct the naming style for add/remove tenant access
* Add exception FlavorNotFound catching for add/remove tenant access
* Improve input validation for add/remove tenant access

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icbf92115be6f33f943b3663373f84e1b12895225

In this case a TODO note is recommended.'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-07-22 10:49:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't think we want non skipped tests which fail with no explanation at all. I think a work around for the bug is appropriate so the test passes and a TODO which links to the bug report so it can be fixed later."}, {'account_id': 1636, 'date': '2013-07-22 18:31:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I think the reason why the deleting the VM doesn't update the volume is because the wrong API is being used to mark the volume as "in-use". I think the test should be going through nova so that the volume actually gets attached, and the nova structures are updated to know about the volume, instead of calling the Cinder API that just marks the volume as "in-use".

More details in the inline comment.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-07-23 01:05:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Add stress test to attach volumes to vm's

This test creates a vm and volume. After that it attaches the volume
to the vm.

Implements: bp stress-tests

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-31 03:36:29.000000000', 'message': "Cleanup repo revision handling.

 * The use of the parameter 'version_to_test' is ambiguous, and
   implies that it is possible to specify an openstack release name
   like 'folsom' or 'grizzly'.  In fact, what is being specified
   is a git revision, branch, or tag.  The upstream branches are
   named 'stable/folsom' or 'stable/grizzly', and changing the name
   to 'tempest_repo_revision' should make it easier to deduce that
   such values are required.
 * Do not provide a default revision of 'master' - use the repo
   default instead.
 * Remove source tree cleanup for the 'folsom' branch.  There is
   no such branch upstream, it is 'stable/folsom', and besides,
   specifying the branch will provide a tempest tree compatible
   with the folsom release.

Change-Id: Iab117cffea22b50480bd88e3ea4d5eba55a69fe5
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup repo revision handling.

 * The use of the parameter 'version_to_test' is ambiguous, and
   implies that it is possible to specify an openstack release name
   like 'folsom' or 'grizzly'.  In fact, what is being specified
   is a git revision, branch, or tag.  The upstream branches are
   named 'stable/folsom' or 'stable/grizzly', and changing the name
   to 'tempest_repo_revision' should make it easier to deduce that
   such values are required.
 * Do not provide a default revision of 'master' - use the repo
   default instead.
 * Remove source tree cleanup for the 'folsom' branch.  There is
   no such branch upstream, it is 'stable/folsom', and besides,
   specifying the branch will provide a tempest tree compatible
   with the folsom release.

Change-Id: Iab117cffea22b50480bd88e3ea4d5eba55a69fe5

commit_message:
Implements host uptime API call for cell setup.

Fixes bug os-hypervisors/<id>/uptime fails in cell setup.Implements
'get_host_uptime' for cells_api, which returns hypervisor uptime
from the target child cell.

Fixes bug LP 1192911

Change-Id: Iac75e46e565f17c91117dcb810f6d2f2e62708d8

commit_message:
Switching to oslo importutils in the stress tests

The importutils is helper module for dynamic class and module,
 loading.

The importutils is compatible with python 2.6 and it is
used in multiple other openstack projects.

The previously used importlib defined with python 2.7.

Change-Id: I4e99ccf9d51cea28584c9d28a4aceab633b3f998

Enable glance client V2 to upload image data.

Adds support for uploading image data to the client library and CLI.

Related to bp glance-client-v2

commit_message:
Fix LDAP test use of assignment driver

A test is using the 'project' member through the
identity_api driver, but this member has been moved
to the assignment_api driver.

Part of fix for bug 1204605

Change-Id: I8129bbcf1ec3dc3834545b948f45f456537da8aa

commit_message:
Use state transition checker wait function in the ec2 image tests

Now the test_register_get_deregister_ami_image can use the usual
transition checker wait logic.
Previously the bug 1074904 prevented it.

Change-Id: I75d90c92aaa50dc62f15a962a5f14ba395b2948c

commit_message:
Image build cleanup

* Removes apt repository nonesense
* Adds support for fedora images
* Separates elements between the distros
* Cleans up the image build variables

partially implements blueprint rpm-integration

Change-Id: I772da1d039584e6def0529bbcab5b3f9c0f9566b

Delete unused templates

The /templates/index.html was auto-generated by Pecan, and I think a
html template is never need in a api based service.

[{'created': '2013-07-31 12:58:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix return error when resource can't be found

By current implement, the HTTP request for /v2/resources/<resource_id>
will return 500 if there is no coresponding resource or the resource id
is invalid. And the response is as below:

{"error_message": "{"debuginfo": null, "faultcode": "Server",
"faultstring": "list index out of range"}"}

After fixed, the response will be like this:

{"error_message": "{"debuginfo": null, "faultcode": "Client",
"faultstring": "Invalid input for field/attribute resource_id.
Value: '9'. Unknown resource"}"}

Fixes bug: 1195925

Change-Id: I73c73fb3ba57bc6cbbf421f9ac5ec3cdb68ce784

commit_message:
Fix return error when resource can't be found

By current implement, the HTTP request for /v2/resources/<resource_id>
will return 500 if there is no coresponding resource or the resource id
is invalid. And the response is as below:

{"error_message": "{"debuginfo": null, "faultcode": "Server",
"faultstring": "list index out of range"}"}

After fixed, the response will be like this:

{"error_message": "{"debuginfo": null, "faultcode": "Client",
"faultstring": "Invalid input for field/attribute resource_id.
Value: '9'. Unknown resource"}"}

Fixes bug: 1195925

Change-Id: I73c73fb3ba57bc6cbbf421f9ac5ec3cdb68ce784
(cherry picked from commit fbb1eb9285c7787f8508d3f69790522ff6847fc8)

Well: the answer is simple: Jenkins does not fail on the gate job because tests are not executed as Aaron pointed out. So if you just do tox -epy27 the tests will pass. Maybe there's something weird about testr that cause the error to be masked when running more than one test suites at the same time, but this is just speculation at this point."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-26 13:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Fix test fail in neutron.tests.unit.test_security_groups_rpc

If running:

tox -epy27 neutron.tests.unit.test_security_groups_rpc

Tests fail with: DuplicateOptError: duplicate option: root_helper
as this is already registered and can be removed.

Fixes bug: 1204700

Change-Id: I8b591357988c5546ae55b6531cf1786b7eb84e20

commit_message:
Add security group commands

* Add security group: create, delete, list, set, show
* Add server: add secgroup, remove secgroup
* Add security group rule: create, delete, list
* Add Oslo's strutils and gettextutils

* Adds parseractions.RangeAction() to handle option arguments of either a single number
  or a range of numbers: '--port 25'  or '--port 1024:65535'

Blueprint: nova-client

Change-Id: Iad2de1b273ba29197709fc4c6a1036b4ae99725f

commit_message:
Allow to specify the endpoint type to use

Not everybody will want to use publicURL, so let's make this configurable.

Change-Id: Ice85a8ef1083580d89285e83239de872939665af
Fixes: bug#1188469
(cherry picked from commit e541fcb0d47e0beb447fb1a3ce1d62881fa382f8)

[{'created': '2013-07-12 19:55:58.000000000', 'message': 'Enable config_drive_cdrom option on libvirt

Some OSes (e.g. Windows) require config drive to be a cdrom device to access
iso9660 filesystem on it. Option config_drive_cdrom covers such scenarios. This
change enables the option on libvirt.

Fixes: bug #1155842
Change-Id: I6c08b1b8040a1fd0db8e2b3b1fc798060733001f
'}, {'created': '2013-07-16 10:28:17.000000000', 'message': "Config drive attached as cdrom

Some guest OSes (e.g. Windows) require config drive to be a cdrom device
to access the iso9660 filesystem on it. To satisfy such scenarios, this
change enables the 'hw_config_drive_type' property in image metadata so
that the type of config drive can be set to 'disk' or 'cdrom' per image.

Fixes: bug #1155842
Change-Id: I6c08b1b8040a1fd0db8e2b3b1fc798060733001f

commit_message:
Config drive attached as cdrom

Some guest OSes (e.g. Windows) require config drive to be a cdrom device
to access the iso9660 filesystem on it. Option config_drive_format is
therefore set to also control the device type of config drive. If it's
set to 'iso9660', config drive will be cdrom; if it's 'vfat', config
drive will be disk.

DocImpact
Fixes: bug #1155842
Change-Id: I6c08b1b8040a1fd0db8e2b3b1fc798060733001f

commit_message:
Begin Python 3 compatability

* use six.iteritems()
* replace basestring with six.string_types
* convert print statements to functions (they're all debugging and should
  be removed eventually anyway)

* clean up OpenStack copyright: LLC -> Foundation

Change-Id: Icb14212bcb408e63816bfec3922a697bc1a6c946

commit_message:
Attempt to build all books

Modifies tools/validate.py to run "mvn clean generate-sources"
in every directory that has a pom.xml file.

The script will fail with an error if any of the books fail to build.
It will terminate on the first failure.

Fixes bug 1031374

For now, we aren't gating on openstack-training

Change-Id: Ic0136e4245e8e4bfa2e790574e3ec82c944c4b02

When install ceilometer with devstack, if do not set environment
variable OS_AUTH_URL, then devstack will set os_aut_url as empty
in /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf, this will cause both

commit_message:
Do not set os_aut_url for ceilometer

When install ceilometer with devstack, if do not set environment
variable OS_AUTH_URL, then devstack will set os_aut_url as empty
in /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf, this will cause both
ceilometer-agent-central and ceilometer-agent-compute cannot start.

Fix bug 1205776

Change-Id: I32c77c92dc2e9d03c86e703f170e0216dd829a61

commit_message:
manage-vdi: Wait until devices have been created before mounting

kpartx creates partition devices asynchronously - it may exit before
the devices have been created.  This may cause a subsequent mount call
to fail, because the device it is trying to mount does not yet exist.
kpartx now has a -s option which makes it wait for the devices to be
created before returning, but the version XenServer's dom0 doesn't have
this option.   Work around this by retrying the mount.

When dom0's kpartx is updated, we will be able to use the -s option.

Change-Id: I823a8eac4f3a2ef313d06e21da0f38ed46d7386a

[{'created': '2013-07-31 12:39:34.000000000', 'message': 'Use correct hostname to get instances.

socket.getfqdn() would return a fully qualified domain name
which maybe invalid for nova to get instances by hostname.
If the host that runs devstack is virtual(like running
devstack on AWS), socket.getfqdn() may return a domain name
which is not the host name and nova cannot use that to get
instances running on current host.

Fix bug: #1166717

Change-Id: Ic6cc8607bcdeee720c5d46d44fbaa589b4fb950e
(cherry picked from commit 16f8e14b24006b23e1965329fa27ab7fcab3e6de)
'}]
commit_message:
Use correct hostname to get instances.

socket.getfqdn() would return a fully qualified domain name
which maybe invalid for nova to get instances by hostname.
If the host that runs devstack is virtual(like running
devstack on AWS), socket.getfqdn() may return a domain name
which is not the host name and nova cannot use that to get
instances running on current host.

Fix bug: #1166717

Change-Id: Ic6cc8607bcdeee720c5d46d44fbaa589b4fb950e
(cherry picked from commit 16f8e14b24006b23e1965329fa27ab7fcab3e6de)

commit_message:
install oslo from upstream in devstack

the libraries that have graduated from oslo incubation need to be
made available in devstack so that projects can develop against
upstream versions of these libraries, and that we can test their
compatibility in the gate.

This should also allow us to force global requirements on all the
projects during installation.

Change-Id: Idf527b16b50eb58564ec74428290cd31424f5de2

The -d option calls testtools.run directly. highlighting the issue. As Roman Podolyaka pointed out using nosetests has the same issue also.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-07-30 07:01:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Michael, thanks for clarification. I still got some question though: if I'd use 'nosetests' for entire unittests, there're some other import related issues. Do you plan to fix those as well? If so, do you plan to fix them in this patch set or submit a separate patch?"}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-07-30 09:48:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Huang, cinder migrated away from nosetests towards using testtools and testrepository for its testing framework. So I am not planing on fixing those issues you see as part of this patch or looking into it. ./run_tests.sh -d sometest should run what every test you want and you will be able to use a debugger in your test also.

But noestests should still be able to run most tests but it may have issues which tests that are skipped for various reasons. These tests are now marked via testtools to skip. So there may be some isssues there but that is different form this patch. This is a guess at the problem you are seeing as I am seeing some strange import errors when running nosetests.'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2013-07-31 05:03:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Fix oslo.config.cfg.NoSuchOptError when running individual tests

We need to import cinder.common.config wherever we are using an olso
configuration option from this module. Otherwise it is not necessarily
the case that olso knows about the option and it complains.

cinder.tests imports this configuration module but it not the case that
this module has been imported when you you are running individual tests.

Change-Id: I8f2c966848f55c80213d2ecd2dbf75b777627e6b
Fixes: bug #1203737

commit_message:
Flavor ID added to Flavor creation form

Flavor ID supported values are:
* integer
* uuid4
* auto

Using 'auto' generates a random uuid4.

Clean method from Edit Form removed as unnecessary.

Flavor tests updated.

Fixes: bug #1189877

Change-Id: I222836d7a84b66891d5380f323bf123122044d30

commit_message:
Sort messages by marker (FIFO key)

Fixes the "FIFO not guaranteed" bug caused by sorting message listings
by '_id' instead of 'k'. The bug only applies to the MongoDB storage
driver.

This patch also included a few minor stylistic tweaks in the interest of
conistency and readability.

Change-Id: I3371723fab3ac6df90757bd9035f67ebf3610cfc
Fixes: bug #1202428

commit_message:
Fix extensions agent follow API v3 rules

* Add decorator expected_errors
* Use AgentBuildExists instead of generic exception catching in create
* Use HTTPBadRequest instead of HTTPUnprocessableEntity
* Rename the request parameter 'para' to 'agent' for update

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

DocImpact

Change-Id: I45203203b8396517ef94e604366183ce93810205

commit_message:
Fix the argument of UnknownArgument exception

This change sets the real UnknownArgument instead of the last
valid one in the exception raised by the API.

Fixes bug #1201839

Change-Id: I22e1dadbe9a90e03e8ccfbcc6e0e8dc3f17c5a3e
(cherry picked from commit 384617f6ca98723cd9c1ad66d74c4cb827fdf42c)

Connection in ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py

ensure_index() is used rather than create_index() to be more efficient.

This index is needed because get_samples() in

'}]
commit_message:
Add index for db.meter by descending timestamp

Fixes bug #1193906

Added an index for db.meter to sort by descending time stamp for class
Connection in ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py

ensure_index() is used rather than create_index() to be more efficient.

This index is needed because get_samples() in
ceilometer/storage/impl_mongodb.py sorts by descending timestamp.  Without an
index, MongoDB will fail to sort if the database is too large.

Change-Id: I23070f153ce03a8d6d8c9f17f05e2d5dae38647e
(cherry picked from commit e984f28b00e3a073c176f6435507f5bce1c82d30)

just change the LOG method from info to debug in places where produce

heavily output.

Change-Id: I06e1f06340a2e7b782d3c7461ea86b629dadf05d

commit_message:
Lose weight for Ceilometer log in verbose mode

When setting verbose=True, the log level will be set to INFO, so we
just change the LOG method from info to debug in places where produce
heavily output.

If want to get debug level logs, set debug=True in ceilometer.conf.

Change-Id: I06e1f06340a2e7b782d3c7461ea86b629dadf05d
Fixes: bug 1192170

commit_message:
Storwize/SVC: Use reserved percentage from conf.

For reserved_percentage, use the value from the configuration file
instead of 0.

Change-Id: I549822c09449f8d9fc0c8b84d56660c381bddbd5

'}, {'created': '2013-07-24 17:27:24.000000000', 'message': "Make ServerXMLSerializationTest DRYer

Move server's description info to setUp() to get rid of duplicate data.

commit_message:
Make ServerXMLSerializationTest DRYer

Move server's description info to setUp() to get rid of duplicate data.
Make user's and admin's attributes static class variables and
extract function which checks obligatory admin/user attributes.
Extract function which checks amount and values of fields in XMLized result.

Blueprint: nova-tests-code-duplication
Change-Id: Iffaec9555476cb8006130ec97f455d7810815970

commit_message:
Disable per-user rate limiting by default

The rate limiting enabled via api_rate_limit, is per user rate limiting
which does not protect against intentional DOS, instead DOS rate
limiting should be elsewhere. Furthermore useful values for this are very deployment
specific.

* Private deployments simply don't need it.
* Public deployments need something more sophisticated (queue depth based,
  not static values).
* Folks that do want it as belt-and-braces want semi-decent defaults
  but there is no need to default it on.

Part of more sane defaults effort.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I5451f6f90a6448c838612f180f0af750213a62bf

ok, so this is currently wedged because python-ceilometerclient requires python-keystoneclient <0.3 in all released versions. And the global requirements is now python-keystoneclient >= 0.3.

So for this to land the ceilometer team needs to make a python ceilometerclient release with the updated requirements lifted.

Also, python-keystoneclient should always be installed last here in case there were other caps.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-07-17 02:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

unit test here now require an old version nova, which requires python-keystoneclient<3.0. This requirement cause the version confliction.

you pip install nova?'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-07-17 14:52:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

not nova master, an old nova version

that statement about nova is very concerning. The point of the gate is that everything is testing with everyone else's newest versions. commit_message:
uncap python-keystoneclient version requirement

if any of the projects specify a capped client, it has the
potential for preventing that client from being tested in the
gate. To fix this we have to uncap maximum versions of all
openstack client code in all openstack projects.

Move keystone client to the end to deal with the fact that
other clients might ask for older keystone client until they
release.

Fixes bug #1200214

Change-Id: I74602d988fceb51802e93d623bc6172573e0fd07

'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-07-29 16:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Is this really necessary? We kinda had this comment in -common/libraries/passwords.rb that said that "databases are named after the OpenStack project nickname, like "nova" or "glance". (Though I guess it really means data bags, not databases).

Is there a specific use case for having this configurable?'}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-07-29 16:58:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ionut, originally it was set to quantum, which flied in the face of this rule, so I had done this in the event some backwards compatible behavior was required.  I'm happy to just code it to openstack-network though and update the commit message."}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-07-30 03:33:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rebased'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-07-30 03:33:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-07-30 08:12:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sorry, Alan, I didn't understand your last comment. So what exactly is the bug that this commit is fixing?"}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-07-30 13:41:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ionut,

Most (all?) of the other stackforge cookbooks name the service_password databag after the cookbook.  This cookbook has the service_password databag named after the project nickname.  As you say, that is generally the approach for database names.

See the following for an example from openstack-image:

https://github.com/stackforge/cookbook-openstack-image/blob/413c654a1f38ed016ba7ffa503f59ae6db7d6bb0/spec/spec_helper.rb#L29

I propose the service password is named "openstack-network"

I do not have to make it an attribute, I was just doing that to support anyone who wanted to override and keep it set to "quantum" but I'm *happy* to just change it to openstack-network directly.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-07-30 13:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Alright. I think I see what you're saying. So this commit is only for cosmetics so we don't have the old "quantum" name hardcoded, right?

AFAICT the parameter to the service_password/db_password/user_password methods is completely arbitrary as long as it's consistent with other usage. I dislike having another configurable parameter just for that. 

If we really want to have something generic though, wouldn't the straightforward argument to service_password be the service name? i.e. node["openstack"]["network"]["service_name"]'}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-07-30 15:01:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If we want consistency (and I really don't care if its configurable personally) then we should just the service_password from being hard coded to "quantum" to being hard coded to "openstack-network"

This should make it consistent with the other cookbooks.

If you agree, I'll just adjust it for that.  We can make configurability a separate patch in the future if we like.'}, {'account_id': 2340, 'date': '2013-07-30 15:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Agreed.'}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-07-30 15:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2013-07-30 15:10:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-30 15:16:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Adjust service password

Adjust service_password to match other stackforge
cookbooks.  Right now, we name them after the
cookbook itself, so this should be set to
openstack-network and not quantum.

Change-Id: Ia117aa907f71b9025d13907c7d5ea04fde368774

commit_message:
Fix transformer's LOG TypeError

When transform cpu meter to cpu_util at first time, it will raise
TypeError by LOG counter argument.

Change-Id: Ie0915d2a4e51cd35a018339dca9700bb8c56ec80
Fixs: bug #1206816

Fixed ohai call for kernel version

The correct automatic attribute is node["kernel"]["release"]

Change-Id: Ic3c18bf9be937a36c4a0d8f690cb7336892c9c8f

commit_message:
Modify relative paths of lib, elements for packaging

(Based on review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36009)

Scripts test for existence of ../share/diskimage-builder and
fall-back to ../ if not found. This allows scripts to run unmodified
from a packaged installation or a local archive/repository.

Change-Id: I0cf4c1fdb8e42ec284c56860cb15818632b93b9e

commit_message:
Refactor JSONSchema handling code

This to better support both Draft 3 and Draft 4 simultaneously.

Additionally, we fix some bugs in the API v1 Schemas.

Change-Id: Iead88f0fb1320ef4ad545a2b66a53b82424c4b14

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 15:48:56.000000000', 'message': 'Update to latest oslo rootwrap

Update Cinder rootwrap to the latest from oslo-incubator. This allows
to import the latest filters and bugfixes, in preparation for the
havana release.

All the changes are coming directly from the Oslo "rootwrap" module

Change-Id: Ie26562b9e934d48275dbd3993af1a8d0bdde77d1

commit_message:
Update to latest oslo rootwrap

Update Cinder rootwrap to the latest from oslo-incubator. This allows
to import the latest filters and bugfixes, in preparation for the
havana release.

All the changes are coming directly from the Oslo "rootwrap" module
sync.

Change-Id: Ie26562b9e934d48275dbd3993af1a8d0bdde77d1

[{'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-07-09 12:10:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

It seems like a reasonable change to the default. Most people will not see the difference.

However, just wonder if we should fail with an exception."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-07-09 12:13:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Most of the time we use safe_find_sr which throws the exception.'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-07-10 14:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rebased'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-07-10 14:34:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks reasonable.

Would be good to see a unit test though. Waiting for jenkins before I up vote any higher.'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-07-10 14:40:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm not sure what the benefit of the unit test would be?

I assume that we shouldn't have a unit test to check that the default value doesn't change? which would be the only way to check that default-sr:true is correct syntax.

In which case the only functionality which could be unit tested is that the warning gets logged if a default SR doesn't exist - which doesn't seem worth enforcing through a unit test."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-07-10 14:50:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-10 16:10:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
XenAPI: Change the default SR to be the pool default

The default SR should be the pools default - but it might be unset
if a host has been removed from a host aggregate (i.e. removed from
the pool).  In this case make sure that we do give a decent error
message.

DocImpact - need to regenerate the defaults doc

Fixes: bug 1198239

Change-Id: I116f65ece94f839e63b085480ba4f8974119d2bb

This generally should only ever show up in dev environments, but is
also a sane course of action should it show in production.

commit_message:
Fix extension server_meta follow API v3 rules

* add decorator expected_errors
* change 'meta' to 'metadata' for show and update that is
consistent with other actions
* use is_valid_body instead of catching AttributeError and ValueError,
because AttributeError and ValueError is too generic.

Partially implements bp v3-api-extension-versioning

DocImpact

Change-Id: Icdb353b077620c1ba690f3679dea6a8956847d36

'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-07-30 07:17:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-30 09:58:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is a good patch, and on the face of it a good solution, but the idea of allowing a name to be supplied kind of conflicts with something I have been working on.

When you update a stack, sometimes a resource has to be replaced completely. Right now we delete it and then create the replacement. That sucks, because you have downtime in between. What we really want to do is create the replacement, change all references to point to it, and then delete the original. (See bug 1176142.)

That means we'll need two versions of the resource to exist simultaneously, so if creating a replacement with the same name before the original is deleted will fail then basically updates will not work.

(BTW I think the example in the screenshot is a little unfair. You've created a stack with a long, ugly name and then complained that long, ugly resource names get generated from it.)"}, {'account_id': 7256, 'date': '2013-07-30 15:27:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

@Zane nova instance names are simply tags supplied by the user and aren't required to be unique. I think this is the same across most, if not all, openstack resources so it should not prevent you from creating a new resource with the same name before you delete the old one."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-30 15:56:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: No score

If that's the case then I withdraw my objection :) Though I agree about also allowing updates to the name.

commit_message:
Assign rackspace server name from physical_resource_name.

The default implementation of physical_resource_name() assigns a name
which includes some context and randomness.

physical_resource_name() is overridden to optionally allow the 'name'
property to specify the physical name. The same technique is used in
OS::Swift::Container, and 'name' matches the property in the underlying
Nova API.

Change-Id: I5769513a4461d5067dca516d0f03e02bb444f379

commit_message:
Support any distribution without UserData/MetaData

A template without UserData or MetaData sections should work with any
distribution, regardless of whether or not a setup script exists for
it in the Cloud Servers resource. The setup script only exists so that
the UserData and MetaData sections will configure the server.

Bug 1204650

Change-Id: Ie795ff63a5a15916c67d96782ea01d604d4768b0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-06 20:47:26.000000000', 'message': 'Moves scheduler.rpcapi.prep_resize call on compute.api to conductor

This change moves the scheduler.rpcapi.prep_resize from
compute.api.resize to conductor and it calls
conductor.api.migrate_server instead.

This is part of other changes that will completely move cold
migration to conductor.

Next change will move compute.rpcapi.prep_resize and all
related logic from the scheduler to conductor.

Partially implements bp cold-migrations-to-conductor

Change-Id: I2eaff7e94c77deb03a6843f316e243b284e31666

commit_message:
Moves scheduler.rpcapi.prep_resize call on compute.api to conductor

This change moves the scheduler.rpcapi.prep_resize from
compute.api.resize to conductor and it calls
conductor.api.migrate_server instead.

This is part of other changes that will completely move cold
migration to conductor.

Next change will move compute.rpcapi.prep_resize and all
related logic from the scheduler to conductor.

Partially implements bp cold-migrations-to-conductor

Change-Id: I2eaff7e94c77deb03a6843f316e243b284e31666

commit_message:
Allow use of local conductor

Fixes bug 1204864

Conductor API import was directly importing remote API not allowing
use of use_local flag in nova.

Change-Id: Ieea410ac6b90fedb6871e0f4c3d02e6a35363439
(cherry picked from commit c6a2daeab5ca6988b7565092516f39916a360445)

I think a test that check the source field is needed."}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-24 16:13:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-24 16:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Fail in Jenkins comes from commit title >= 50 chars (no fail in pep8 tox tests in local for the first commit, only on the 2+ commits => I don't know why but that already happened to me) => I patch it now.

"I think a test that check the source field is needed."
If no source is set by user in the POSTed sample, source is set to the default configured counter_source, "openstack" in this case, so if no source is set, I got something like '"source": "04b7fc715d35474eb96e4fccc80bf212:openstack"'.
I don't see which test to do but if you think about something in particular, let me know and I will do what is necessary.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-07-24 16:44:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If the bug 1202689 exists this is because no test (or the test is not working) in tests/api/v2/test_post_samples_scenarios.py check if the published source is correct, so we need a test to ensure this (or fix the existing one if a test exists)."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-24 16:46:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

The fix is good, but I would prefer we entirely fix the code of that function. It's a bit crappy."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-24 17:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/63/38463/2/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/3688 : SUCCESS in 1m 21s

- http://logs.openstack.org/63/38463/2/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/3615 : SUCCESS in 6m 04s
'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-07-25 06:30:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

I have take a look to the tests, its seems that all tests miss to verify the content of the posted sample in the pipeline.

I have opened a bug to propose a separate review for the tests

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1204593

If this review is not merged I can include it in the futur review ( because when tests will be written it should be failed without your fix :) )'}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-25 07:10:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Mehdi: 
OK I understand, I was thinking you meant that there was a lack for a "if" in the code. I agree with you for the unit test, but I had a look at the tests too and only the return of the function is tested, not the data sent to the pipeline as you mentioned in the bug, but I didn't know how to test the data actually sent/stored. :o)

Maybe you should see this bug too: message_id field wrong for user-defined samples => https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1202696
In the code, the 'message_id's are not sent back from the pipeline and not set into the returned samples' list.

@Julien:
"I would prefer we entirely fix the code of that function"
Tell me what you prefer: either we can merge this tiny fix and you can fix more deeper after (unit test for Mehdi and code for you), or I can release the bug on the bug tracker and you can assign it to yourself to do the job in a more comprehensive way.

Tell me ! :o)'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-07-25 12:16:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I'm ok with this fix as it is for now since Mehdi's reported a bug that would force us to work on this issue more completely."}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-07-29 07:49:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have started to work on the refactoring/tests of this code, This changeset doesn't fix the issue when the user is a admin and samples have different project_id. Unfortunately, the actual tests won't test this case. 

We must create a PublishContext for each different source of samples.

You can see the refactored code, that include this changes and take care of the special case of the admin user, here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39031/"}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-31 08:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Mehdi: OK ! I abandon my change and let you do it in yours.

"This changeset doesn't fix the issue when the user is a admin and samples have different project_id.": I suppose you mean different "source_id"? There is no consistency lock on "project_id".'}, {'account_id': 7993, 'date': '2013-07-31 08:28:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

You can see the refactored code, that includes this change and takes care of the special case of the admin user, here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39031/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-24 12:50:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes source field stored without project_id prefix for user-defined samples

When POSTing user-defined data in Ceilometer, if we set the source field or not (default source used)
in the sample, the returned sample from POST contains the inserted value (or the default one)
with a prefix (project_id:). But when requesting after on the sample, the prefix is missing.
This is not possible then to know if a sample comes from internal counters or user-defined ones.

Change-Id: I65ea346da43c66935b088c7e304e4d40ebb05f41
Fixes: bug #1202689
'}, {'created': '2013-07-24 16:13:11.000000000', 'message': 'Source without prefix for user-defined samples

When POSTing user-defined data in Ceilometer, if we set the source field or not (default source used)
in the sample, the returned sample from POST contains the inserted value (or the default one)
with a prefix (project_id:). But when requesting after on the sample, the prefix is missing.
This is not possible then to know if a sample comes from internal counters or user-defined ones.

Change-Id: I65ea346da43c66935b088c7e304e4d40ebb05f41
Fixes: bug #1202689
'}]
commit_message:
Source without prefix for user-defined samples

When POSTing user-defined data in Ceilometer, if we set the source field or not (default source used)
in the sample, the returned sample from POST contains the inserted value (or the default one)
with a prefix (project_id:). But when requesting after on the sample, the prefix is missing.
This is not possible then to know if a sample comes from internal counters or user-defined ones.

Change-Id: I65ea346da43c66935b088c7e304e4d40ebb05f41
Fixes: bug #1202689

commit_message:
Load backends before deploy app in client tests

The backends should be loaded before the app is deployed for
the client tests, otherwise the wrong backends may be loaded
when the app is deployed.

Part of fix for bug 1204605

Change-Id: I70680c3daea3a863bcbde07b1ee7e062cd150e51

commit_message:
Ec2 credentials table not created during testing

This change makes it so that the SQL Ec2Credential unit tests
can be run individually. It does this by making sure the
credential table model is available before the tables are
created.

Before this change, you couldn't run these tests individually
and would get an error that the ec2_credential table doesn't
exist.

Part of fix for bug 1179259

Change-Id: I68c8b91b18ac0065628c979e5bcc56152ae14916

The compute_driver parameter is a mandatory parameter only for nodes
running the Nova compute service. However Other Nova services like
Nova API actually call the compute_driver_matches() function.

Change-Id: Iac7cd46c6bdb4268cfbc650dcde0c95e69545f04
Fixes: bug #1184641

commit_message:
Verify that CONF.compute_driver is defined

The compute_driver parameter is a mandatory parameter only for nodes
running the Nova compute service. However Other Nova services like
Nova API actually call the compute_driver_matches() function.

Change-Id: Iac7cd46c6bdb4268cfbc650dcde0c95e69545f04
Fixes: bug #1184641
(cherry picked from commit fa5079c257c00b8b56138233aca5755c54db9143)
