[{'created': '2013-07-30 08:43:47.000000000', 'message': 'Make NEC Plugin keep error resources

NEC Plugin used to ignore OFC errors while deleting resources from OFC,
and it could leave some unused resources on OFC. If OFC generates id
which is in remained resources when creating new resource, it will fail.

This commit makes NEC Plugin keep logical resource when it failed to
delete resource from OFC not to leave orphan resource on OFC, and raise
exception to tell the user that the resouce status is Error.

NOTE: The user can retry deletion. If the resouce was successfully
deleted from OFC in retries, the logical resource will be deleted.

Fixes: bug #1206416
Change-Id: Ifea38dfe3fe8b18d7ae1cedf86a23008549250cc

commit_message:
Make NEC Plugin keep error resources

NEC Plugin used to ignore OFC errors while deleting resources from OFC,
and it could leave some unused resources on OFC. If OFC generates id
which is in remained resources when creating new resource, it will fail.

This commit makes NEC Plugin keep logical resource when it failed to
delete resource from OFC not to leave orphan resource on OFC, and raise
exception to tell the user that the resouce status is Error.

NOTE: The user can retry deletion. If the resouce was successfully
deleted from OFC in retries, the logical resource will be deleted.

Fixes: bug #1206416
Change-Id: Ifea38dfe3fe8b18d7ae1cedf86a23008549250cc

commit_message:
Replace rackspace PublicKey property with key_name.

This fetches a keypair that is registered with nova and
uses the public key, instead of having to specify the entire
public key as a launch parameter.

Tested to work on instances launched in DFW.

This shares the keypair lookup method with AWS::EC2::Instance but
adopts the property name of the underlying nova API. This property name
will align with the yet-to-be-written OS::Nova::Server.

Change-Id: I2dceb93a4544e5f99d246233f240fe99667efadf

This is more of a feature than a bug IMO'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-07-26 02:26:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi,
This is not a feature. This is actually a very serious and blocking bug. The VNC console does not work with the VCDriver.
The bug is critical and really meets all of the standards for grizzly backport potential hence the backport
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-07-29 15:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

For what its worth, the original developer of the Grizzly work for VC believed that VNC worked for both ESX and VC drivers, but seems to only have tested with the ESX driver, and the logic for looking up the VNC IP address that works for the ESX driver does not work for the VC driver (this is what this patch addresses).  

Looking at the actual code, the risk of introducing a regression seems negligible, as the only non-test code introduced does not modify the code that works for the ESX driver, it just overrides the old method with a new method that uses the correct lookup logic for the VC driver. 

Since VNC consoles in Horizon are pretty fundamental to the user experience, I see OpenStack users who end up manually patching this change-set into their existing Grizzly deployments.  Having this backported would be much cleaner and less error prone, and to me introduces very little risk.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-07-30 18:25:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: No score

Ok, I don't feel strongly enough to keep blocking it then if enough people want it."}, {'account_id': 1420, 'date': '2013-07-31 00:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
VNC console does not work with VCDriver

Introduces get_vnc_console_vcenter as a way to get
a modified vnc_console object that connects to the
ESXi host underneath vCenter control.

* adds new fake classes for testing
* documents classes, methods & API logic

fixes bug: #1178369

(cherry picked from commit 271fc68c1852e3764b7c64d71cd28ac3f803ecba)

Conflicts:

	nova/virt/vmwareapi/fake.py

Change-Id: I48430cb9bc9615e02ca9af235f97853f3f0bdafd

commit_message:
Logging enhanced

If the current user is a superuser, the deployment logs box will display Status Details, which usually contain advanced debug information, such as exception stacktrace on the conductor etc

Also, deployment status is now displayed in the deployments table

Change-Id: I17f3485c4457a7e5bbda468900541bb902a0f93c

commit_message:
Add initial qpid driver

This just adds a QpidDriver which re-uses AMQPDriver.

The test-rabbit-{client,server}.py test scripts works fine with this
driver and the URL changed to qpid:///

Change-Id: Ifb72853e83b678b311fecb21fe016af19a67b272

commit_message:
Replace part_handler.py with write-files cloudinit mechanism

part-handler.py was acting as a write-files mechanism.  Instead just
use the write-files mechanism directly to avoid the complexities of
the part-handler.

blueprint: use-cloudinit-write
Change-Id: I6e80c344743d6fd2fa9a49507de6d50e3d9eea73

commit_message:
Move most new rabbit driver code into amqpdriver

All of this code should be reusable by the rabbit driver.

Change-Id: Ib09e467313c9b68f1eba6b615e6fce83f44fee70

commit_message:
Temporarily add eventlet to requirements

We absolutely do not want this to be a requirement, but for the moment
the rabbit and qpid drivers import eventlet and avoid using it at
runtime. This should be cleaned up shortly and we can remove the dep
again.

Change-Id: Iaef75964a502598a94d95aa77f0e44d1f7faba50

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 05:57:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add exception serialization tests

These are pretty comprehensive tests for the exception serialization
code. The code itself code do with a bunch of refactoring, but that will
come later.

The main TODO item is that we need a way for users of the API to
register the list of modules that it wants to allow exceptions to be
deserialized from. There is no need for this to be an end-user
configuration option, but we do need each service to be able to specify
its own list.

Change-Id: Ib2fc3f1ca5da708b41bdc00e8ac6ce0c92399ce8
'}]
commit_message:
Add exception serialization tests

These are pretty comprehensive tests for the exception serialization
code. The code itself code do with a bunch of refactoring, but that will
come later.

The main TODO item is that we need a way for users of the API to
register the list of modules that it wants to allow exceptions to be
deserialized from. There is no need for this to be an end-user
configuration option, but we do need each service to be able to specify
its own list.

Change-Id: Ib2fc3f1ca5da708b41bdc00e8ac6ce0c92399ce8

'}, {'account_id': 7282, 'date': '2013-06-26 08:55:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

To Dan:
This is a test to check whether the timeout mechanism work or not, the eventlet.sleep in the fake_run_vios_command is trying to simulate the unexpected long run of the run_vios_command, which will
be interrupted while the timeout second exceeds.

I admit that sleeping 60 seconds is too long and unnecessary, I have changed the UT to wait for a timeout of 0.1 second for the fake_run_vios_command running 0.5 seconds, which make the running time of this 
test more acceptable: 0.15 second on average on my desktop.

But if you still have your concerns, please also point out the possible solution for this test, any suggestion is highly appreciated.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-06-26 16:55:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7899, 'date': '2013-07-01 03:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-07-01 13:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-07-01 13:31:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Personally, I think taking this approach is unnecessary, dangerous, and otherwise unsatisfactory.

Sleeping for any amount of time in the process of running 7000 other tests in a short period of time is really not okay, IMHO.

I think you should stub out sleep and stub out the timeout context manager and just make sure they're called properly. There's no need, AFAICT, to *actually* sleep or measure the time slept.

Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-07-01 18:36:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5371, 'date': '2013-07-01 18:52:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Fix looks good, but need to fix the unit tests up."}, {'account_id': 7282, 'date': '2013-07-03 06:08:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-03 06:52:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Works for me

commit_message:
The stop lpar method is not properly timing out

The self.run_vios_command(cmd) will not return immediately
such that the polling code in a certain timeout doesn't work
as designed.
Let the self.run_vios_command(cmd) run by another thread by
facilitating the greengthread module in python.

Change-Id: If3d3a342acc44cde79fc1db321cb432cfa5c32ab
Fixes: bug 1182002

commit_message:
Add Stop & Start tests for server actions

1. Add stop & start tests for corresponding server actions
2. Add XML client for stop & start server

Partially implements bp add-missing-server-actions-tests

Depends on bug 1198142

Change-Id: Id311b2fbafc4eb7ebb20ee866c3754d40cdaf902

commit_message:
Update build depends to versions that grow bunnies

pip 1.4 is out. The next version of pbr will depend on it. Addiitonally,
the next version of pbr drops the use of d2to1, so let's go ahead and
remove it here. And, the next release of pbr is going to be a 1.0
release. It turns out it's in production and stuff now, let's not stick
around on the 0.x for forever.

Change-Id: I9572fce2f5f3a95e234a66cbf82ea96ee2949865

[{'created': '2013-07-23 19:06:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add requirement for pywbem>=0.7.0

The driver for EMC storage devices as a backend for cinder

commit_message:
Add requirement for pywbem>=0.7.0

The driver for EMC storage devices as a backend for cinder
requires pywbem 0.7.0.

fixes bug 1204229

Change-Id: I276b62979100203df9eaf24e5807b8053464b663

commit_message:
Ensure metadata is available for os-refresh-config

On Feodra 18 during boot when cron runs os-refresh-config, a race
condition was present, cron was getting run before the metadata was
retrieved. As a result in 49-heat-localip the loop that edited the
metadata was editing nothing.

Change-Id: I1b8048daf42786b9a9008db2062bd62b6a7ee7b9

commit_message:
Upgrade and remove and upgrade setuptools

The current state of setuptools upgrading is a giant giant giant mess
perpetrated on the masses by the lord of evil. Conflicting versions of
things can wind up on the system and then everything breaks.

To fix this, first install setuptools and pip via pip, then remove the
versions of setuptools and pip that ubuntu installed. Then re-install
pip and setuptools and virtualenv via pip just to be sure.

Change-Id: Iefd9cf90d1459aee92eef19b0328e9e77eaea987

[{'created': '2013-07-27 14:43:49.000000000', 'message': 'Remove only_free param to Pool.get()

This is unused. I think I added it before iter_free(), i.e. empty()
was going to be:

  for item in self.get(only_free=True):
      item.close()

rather than:

  for item in self.iter_free():
      item.close()

Change-Id: Ie6d0de3b7453ee036412db10f37d26f04de73cf7
'}]
commit_message:
Remove only_free param to Pool.get()

This is unused. I think I added it before iter_free(), i.e. empty()
was going to be:

  for item in self.get(only_free=True):
      item.close()

rather than:

  for item in self.iter_free():
      item.close()

Change-Id: Ie6d0de3b7453ee036412db10f37d26f04de73cf7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 06:21:56.000000000', 'message': "Pop out 'offset' and 'limit' before use for filter

In previous code of _items() from api/v{1,2}/snapshots.py,
we didn't pop out the 'offset' and 'limit' fields from HTTP
get params before we use such params for filter.This is the
root cause for bug #1205956

For non-admin user, since 'offset' and 'limit' is not in the
allowed_search_options, so the volumes.remove_invalid_options
will help to filter them out. As a result, it walks around this
bug.

But for admin user,the volumes.remove_invalid_options will not
try to filter the search_options.So for admin user, the 'limit'
will appear in search_options, then obviously get no result.

fixed bug #1205956

Change-Id: Ib1a66c9d104ac52d6eae18be7f06d02985d4c2fd

commit_message:
Pop out 'offset' and 'limit' before use for filter

In previous code of _items() from api/v{1,2}/snapshots.py,
and also the _items)_ from api/v1/volume.py.we didn't pop
out the 'offset' and 'limit' fields from HTTP get params
before we use such params for filter.This is the root cause
for bug #1205956

For non-admin user, since 'offset' and 'limit' is not in the
allowed_search_options, so the volumes.remove_invalid_options
will help to filter them out. As a result, it walks around this
bug.

But for admin user,the volumes.remove_invalid_options will not
try to filter the search_options.So for admin user, the 'limit'
will appear in search_options, then obviously get no result.

fixed bug #1205956

Change-Id: Ib1a66c9d104ac52d6eae18be7f06d02985d4c2fd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-23 17:38:21.000000000', 'message': "Add initial rabbit driver

There's obviously an awful lot of work left to do on this. Some 20
FIXMEs, for a start :)

However, the test client can successfully invoke a call() and get a
reply back from the server!

The main complexity is in how the client waits for a reply, especially
where there are multiple threads all waiting for replies. Rather than
follow the current method of spawning off a greenthread (and the implied
dependency on eventlet) to read the replies and pass them to the queue
for the appropriate waiting thread, we instead have one of the waiting
threads take on that responsibility.

Change-Id: I20d3d66a5cc9820752e7eaebd8871ffb235d31c9
"}, {'created': '2013-07-24 07:15:44.000000000', 'message': "Add initial rabbit driver

for the appropriate waiting thread, we instead have one of the waiting
threads take on that responsibility.

Change-Id: I20d3d66a5cc9820752e7eaebd8871ffb235d31c9
"}]
commit_message:
Add initial rabbit driver

There's obviously an awful lot of work left to do on this. Some 20
FIXMEs, for a start :)

However, the test client can successfully invoke a call() and get a
reply back from the server!

The main complexity is in how the client waits for a reply, especially
where there are multiple threads all waiting for replies. Rather than
follow the current method of spawning off a greenthread (and the implied
dependency on eventlet) to read the replies and pass them to the queue
for the appropriate waiting thread, we instead have one of the waiting
threads take on that responsibility.

Change-Id: I20d3d66a5cc9820752e7eaebd8871ffb235d31c9

commit_message:
Fixing host-action on V2

Changed host-actions to GET from POST for reboot, startup
and shutdown, as per nova-api reference documentation.

Change-Id: I863b75960b2e427fd9384a336727132ca3c130c6
Fixes: bug #1206425

Log scrapers are inherently brittle. That said, if someone pipes up here and actually has a log scraper that would be broken with this change, it'd be worth considering. I don't want to hold things up for a hypothetical scraper, though.

Also note that this change makes the little arrow go the other way, so a hypothetical log scraper could be modified to look at the arrow to see what format the message is in.

This change makes it so more information winds up in the logs, enabling easier debugging. I like it."}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-07-31 04:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
log return value before arguments when rsync error

The arguments of rsync command seems too long. If some errors occur, it
is hard to debug. Moving return value of rsync command first could help
people at least know reason of rsync error by manuals.

fixes bug #903406

Change-Id: I1cac7bbca74824a6d47e6ceb9f654d4046fcbb9e

commit_message:
Use the server tags for dimensions and make watch_name optional.

This allows us to stop creating templates with circular dependancies.

So we can change:
  cfn-push-stats --watch {Ref: TheAlarm}
to:
  cfn-push-stats

This makes it closer to AWS and actually better as users can add their
own dimensions via the tags.

Change-Id: I365ae57c2275a2d064075eb1b3e14aa1e418d1ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 12:52:58.000000000', 'message': "Add a get_tags() method to the Metadata class

Tags are not properly implemented in nova so we pass the tags
into the server using the metadata. Since this is call repeatedly
use the cached metadata, don't retrieve it each time.

The heat resource will add the tags like this:
metadata = {
  <user metadata as normal here>
  '__tags__': the user tags
}

Change-Id: I599f22fd5166e88cb3d21a71ead5f48c5c5a9269

commit_message:
Add a get_tags() method to the Metadata class

Tags are not properly implemented in nova so we pass the tags
to nova as metadata. So we now [w]get the nova metadata.
Since this is called repeatedly we cache the metadata.

We also add the nova instance id (uuid) as a guest tag.

Change-Id: I599f22fd5166e88cb3d21a71ead5f48c5c5a9269

commit_message:
Parameter constraint samples for HOT hello world

Adding example for parameter validation constraints to HOT hello world
template to show new syntax and features for parameter constraints in
HOT.

This change depends on changes in the heat github repository, which
need to be completed so this new template can be processed.

Contributes to blueprint hot-parameters

Change-Id: I720f22795c94e4ceacc9ebe030929f9b58e981e9

commit_message:
Add support for classmethod console scripts

 * Previously console_scripts could only reference functions:

     script_name = package.name:function_name

   This change adds support for classmethods:

     script_name = package.name:ClassName.classmethod_name

   This change is necessary to support a Neutron use-case.

 * Fixes bug 1206734

Change-Id: I9509d3f2cea29fee5696936dbbb1d507764f1e81

commit_message:
Add option to serve PXE for baremetal from nova-network

New variable BM_DNSMASQ_FROM_NOVA_NETWORK: if setting this true,
DevStack configures nova-network's dnsmask to provide PXE and does
not run baremetal's one. In this case PXE traffic occur in the fixed-ip
network, so no dedicated network for PXE is needed.

Change-Id: I67cade02c03ab45ab6b77d8da9066d7d5ec6c78b

commit_message:
Rename requires files to standard names.

Rename tools/pip-requires to requirements.txt and tools/test-requires
to test-requirements.txt. These are standard files, and tools in the
general world are growing intelligence about them.

fix bug 1179008

Change-Id: Ie64c8a4cdadafea35f6f1dfa8cd7091deaa5ab82

commit_message:
renamed deprecated glanceclient parameter

According to the sources the parameter --public in python-glanceclient
should be removed after only using the new parameter --is-public in
Devstack.

Change-Id: I25fbb23f4823b3766db647dd50a5b538aad3e55a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-30 18:35:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix fail logic for server of another tenant test

This commit removes the try, finally logic from
test_delete_a_server_of_another_tenant() If the create_server() call
failed then the delete in the finally block would still run. This
would cause the test to error out masking the real reason for the
failure. This commit corrects the behavior by removing the delete and
the try, finally from the test. The base class will properly handle
the cleanup of the created server on class tear down so this delete
wasn't even necessary.

Change-Id: I6ee7c74122b4c88416672e5f0d3f3fb2bd71ab69
"}]
commit_message:
Fix fail logic for server of another tenant test

This commit removes the try, finally logic from
test_delete_a_server_of_another_tenant() If the create_server() call
failed then the delete in the finally block would still run. This
would cause the test to error out masking the real reason for the
failure. This commit corrects the behavior by removing the delete and
the try, finally from the test. The base class will properly handle
the cleanup of the created server on class tear down so this delete
wasn't even necessary.

Change-Id: I6ee7c74122b4c88416672e5f0d3f3fb2bd71ab69

This commit adds eventlet to the tempest requirements list. The oslo
logging and lockutils modules have dependencies on pieces of evenlet
so to avoid any potential import issues this commit adds it to the
requirements list.

Change-Id: Ibdd0a418aec49f569d1f89c47e5cd68162d7ea15
'}]
commit_message:
Add eventlet to requirements.txt

This commit adds eventlet to the tempest requirements list. The oslo
logging and lockutils modules have dependencies on pieces of evenlet
so to avoid any potential import issues this commit adds it to the
requirements list.

Change-Id: Ibdd0a418aec49f569d1f89c47e5cd68162d7ea15

commit_message:
no logging on cms failure

Don't log in the keystoneclient.common.cms as there are some errors
that are expected.  Instead, log in the middleware

bug 1189539

Change-Id: I1e80e2ab35e073d9b8d25fd16b31c64c34cd001d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': "batch updates to firewall ports

One of two patches that fixes bug #1194438.

In the iptables firewall driver, each port method (update_port_filter,
prepare_port_filter, remove_port_filter) makes O(N) calls, where
N=len(firewall.ports), to IptablesManager methods that update dozens
of data structures. Since the FirewallDriver's port methods were
always called in sequence on a list of ports of length M, O(M*N) calls
where made to IptablesManager's bookkeeping methods. In the case of
SecurityGroupAgentRpcMixin.refresh_firewall, which is called every
time an instance is created, M=N. When there are 100 instances on a
compute node, IptablesManager's dictionaries would be updated tens of
thousands of times during refresh_firewall, which started to take a
long time and burnt through many CPU cycles!

This patch changes the interface to FirewallDriver such that all port
methods take a list of ports, which enables much more efficient use.
In the case of the iptables firewall manager, its user will only incur
O(N) calls to IptablesManager methods to refresh all ports on the
firewall rather than O(N^2) as before.

In the iptables firewall driver, further improvement could be made by
incrementally updating its IptablesManager. That is, rather than
bracketing port updates with self._setup_chains and
self._remove_chains, which make the O(N) IptablesManager calls, only
the relevant chains could be modified. However, this improvement
wouldn't affect SecurityGroupAgentRpcMixin.refresh_firewall, which
seems to be the most frequent caller of FirewallDriver methods,
because it passes in a list of ports with length N.

Change-Id: If17eeaec197beae8b8aecffca1f19d4535a7226e

prepare_port_filter, remove_port_filter) makes O(N) calls, where
N=len(firewall.ports), to IptablesManager methods that update dozens

methods start to add up.

to IptablesManager. Now a sequence of M port method calls results in
O(N) calls to IptablesManager methods instead of O(N*M) as before.

Change-Id: If17eeaec197beae8b8aecffca1f19d4535a7226e

commit_message:
defer firewall updates to iptables data structures

One of two patches that fixes bug #1194438.

In the iptables firewall driver, each port method (update_port_filter,
prepare_port_filter, remove_port_filter) makes O(N) calls, where
N=len(firewall.ports), to IptablesManager methods that update dozens
of data structures. When the firewall methods are called in sequence,
e.g., by SecurityGroupAgentRpcMixin, the calls to IptablesManager's
methods start to add up.

This patch changes IptablesFirewallDriver to defer and coalesce calls
to IptablesManager. Now a sequence of M port method calls results in
O(N) calls to IptablesManager methods instead of O(N*M) as before.

Change-Id: If17eeaec197beae8b8aecffca1f19d4535a7226e

(1 inline comment)

I have not yet reviewed this in detail, but I'm concerned about the approach being taken of removing the simple user interface variables. I agree the EXTRA_OPTS stuff in needed to allow tweaking and experimentation (especially for features not yet explicitly supported by devstack), but we should try to make common use cases as simple to configure as possible.

Also, doesn't devstack need to support enabling vxlan tunnels in the openvswitch agent when used with ml2, and maybe also when used with the openvswitch plugin?"}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-07-22 16:47:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Bob, there is apparently a disconnect between the devstack and neutron folks. When I proposed adding direct VXLAN support into devstack, Sean pushed back and said he would no longer accept patches into devstack to proliferate neutron options. Thus, I went with a more generic way. So you can enable VXLAN tunnels using that generic approach. The same will have to apply ML2 unless someone can convince Sean of the merits of going against his previous decision. Please his comments to patchset one here. [1]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/30315/'}, {'account_id': 1689, 'date': '2013-07-22 18:03:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Definitely a disconnect - I had not seen the referenced review. I'm fine with using the EXTRA_OPTS approach for advanced configuration, and agree with Sean that devstack shouldn't need separate code added for pass-through of each individual config item. 

But I'm still concerned about making sure basic devstack/neutron use cases don't require in-depth knowledge of lots of neutron configuration details. 

The most basic devstack use case with ml2, as with the openvswitch or linuxbridge plugins, is a single-node deployment with local tenant networks. I believe this should remain the default. I also think its useful to warn the devstack user in this case that they are not getting cross-node connectivity.

When someone wants to use vlan tenant networks instead of local tenant networks, I guess they could accomplish this using EXTRA_OPTS variables to configure the ml2 plugin's tenant_network_types, the vlan driver's network_vlan_ranges, and the agent's bridge or interface mappings. They'd need to know all the relevant details for the specific plugin and agent being used. 

Right now, they can simply set ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS, TENANT_VLAN_RANGE, PHYSICAL_NETWORK, and OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE, which are all documented in devstack/lib/neutron. The first three of these work exactly the same across the openvswitch, linuxbridge, and ml2 plugins, and only OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE or LB_PHYSICAL_INTERFACE needs to be set based on the agent being used (either can be used with ml2).

Are we really sure we want to remove the explicit support for a basic use case such as vlan tenant networks? If so, do we want to remove this from the openvswitch and linuxbridge plugins' devstack support as well? I'd hate to see basic use cases be less well supported by devstack for ml2 than for the other plugins. My point here is that these are not just pass-through independent config items - they are individual plugin-independant decisions made by the devstack user that together effect multiple configuration items, which vary somewhat between plugins.

Whatever we decide to do for vlan support in ml2 (and the other plugins), we probably want to do something similar for tunnel networks. Personally, I think setting ENABLE_TENANT_TUNNELS should be sufficient, resulting in the proper ml2 or openvswitch plugin config and the proper openvswitch agent config for GRE tunnels. A simple plugin-independent way to use VXLAN instead of GRE also seems to make sense. Again, I don't see these as pass-through config items, but as user decisions effecting multiple config items."}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-07-22 20:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-22 21:50:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

(2 inline comments)

i think it's a shame that it's so difficult to activate vxlan option while using devstack.
in the agent, tunnel_types=vxlan,gre should be set as soon as vxlan and gre are in the ml2 type_drivers.
More generally, I think that Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE could be useful. ENABLE_TENANT_TUNNELS and ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS can be kept for backward compatibility, as a shortcut to activate only one tenant_network_type, but Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE could be used to activate several network types for tenant, with no need to use provider networks. I think it's a shame not having this functionality in Devstack (or with a tricky localrc), because it's the powerful of ML2."}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-07-29 18:17:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (2 inline comments)

Thanks for the review Mathieu. I'm taking into account what you suggest now and hope to post a new patch later today."}, {'account_id': 105, 'date': '2013-07-29 20:35:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-29 21:28:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Update the ML2 configuration in devstack

This commit adds support to devstack to set ML2 options including
MechanismDrivers, TypeDrivers, and TypeDriver specific configuration for ML2
when running with devstack.

This also allows for simple configuration of VLAN, GRE, and VXLAN ML2 devstack
setups with the OVS agent as follows:

    # VLAN configuration
    Q_PLUGIN=ml2
    ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS=True

    # GRE tunnel configuration
    Q_PLUGIN=ml2
    ENABLE_TENANT_TUNNELS=True

    # VXLAN tunnel configuration
    Q_PLUGIN=ml2
    Q_ML2_TENANT_NETWORK_TYPE=vxlan

Fixes bug 1200767

Change-Id: Ib16efac13440b5d50658a0e6be35bc735510a262

commit_message:
Fix .mailmap file search location

It should be in the root project dir, not in the .git dir.

Fixes: bug #1202375

Change-Id: I5d7cd61f3ec9323afed371c7082f2694a7e8347c

maybe move the verify existence logic to a (private?) method.  Idk, might make the auditor code cleaner to have it call verify... I guess there should really just be a method on DiskFile called "verify" that can raise QuarantineError?

Then the auditor just loops over DiskFiles and calls verify on them...  Behaviors not state?

Is there another patch where DiskFile (and related) are pulled into a separate module?  Can that happen earlier in the series?'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-16 01:20:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-07-16 01:20:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-16 01:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-16 02:02:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

@clayg: Regarding behavior vs state:

What is the difference between what the current code is doing and what the verify routine would do? It sounds like name changes.

There are two things that are being proposed here:

  1. Condense the calls so that all four locations that
     used get_data_file_size() method to do the metadata vs
     inode data check are done during object creation

     a. In all cases, a DiskFile object was created and
        then immediately followed by the size call which
        had the side effect of performing the size
        quarantine check

        * side effects can be tough to debug and maintain,
          and given that we want to move towards a defined
          API removing them make it easier to keep that API
          clean and easier to implement

        * It also abstracts how the size information is
          obtained so that other DiskFile implementations in
          the future have the freedom to provide that info
          without tying it to the side effect of the
          quarantining

     b. This change hides the need for the four existing
        locations from making this check explicit, since it
        can be now performed in one location ... in the
        object constructor

  2. Given the above, and that it appears that all GET
     operations for an object perform the same quarantine
     checks as the auditor, we take advantage of that to
     perform the size quarantine check in the constructor,
     leaving the md5sum quarantine check on the close
     method

With these changes, it is proposed that as a result it is easier to abstract the behavior of the DiskFile class (moving towards an API).

As for pulling the DiskFile class out of the server into its own module, I'd be happy to do that before or after the changes (rebasing as necessary). I decided not to do that now just to keep these changes focused on the final API work  so that it is easier for folks to compare the code. That said, if folks do not find this easier to deal with, I can pull that class out before these changes."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-16 02:20:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-07-16 21:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (4 inline comments)

I think the benefit of reusing the size calculation between the auditor and controller is not worth a murky interface.

Having obj_size optionally computed in the constructor feels less clean that a method which when called returned the size of the disk_file in bytes on the storage medium and raises an error if the information is not available.

I think code that wants an instance of the object, and also wants that object to perform the act of computing it's size should call a helper function, or at the very most a classmethod that clearly states what it's doing and returns the instance *and* the computed value.

I fully admit "murky" is a subjective term, so I'd appreciate any suggestions of literature that I should research which define objective qualitative measures for good API's for Class interfaces.  I have limited experience with Zope Interfaces from my time with Twisted and never felt like stdlib ABC's solved the problem fully.  I've never made it through Knuth or the Gang of Four - so I'm mostly by my gut over here.  I am NOT strongly opposed to this patch as it stands, but having spent some time with it - I have some concerns and suggestions.

I hope to discuss further how I can contribute to this effort in tomorrow's DiskFile Refactoring overview: https://plus.google.com/events/crgrr0rbiild90rofjfqtv4magg

Since everyone has agreed that this work needs to happen; yes, I *would* like to fork-lift the class UNMODIFIED ASAP and then apply changes in it's new home.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-16 23:52:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm with Clay here... the interface is a little off. The optional quarantine stuff is weird.

I almost feel like it should happen in the DiskReader.__init__ method (in patchset https://review.openstack.org/35381). That way, if I have a DiskFile that I intend to read, then I get the various checks and such. However, if I have a DiskFile that I'm intending to use for writing, then I don't really give a crap how corrupted, expired, folded, spindled, or mutilated the existing file is; I'm about to blow it away.

If we did things that way, you would be unable to get a DiskReader for a known-busted file. (Obviously it could have a flipped bit somewhere so the MD5 doesn't match, but we can't detect that at initialization time. We can get the cheap checks though.) That would be a lot cleaner IMHO than an optional verify_whatever=False that I might forget but that only blows up my PUT method when the old file is broken."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-07-19 17:15:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: No score

(1 inline comment)

I give a weight to Clay and Sam's argument and I dislike such behaviour variation arguments, but then the fact is that we do quarantine on open already essentially... This is not much worse, IMHO. So I'm dropping my -1, code looks okay now."}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-07-19 17:33:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: (4 inline comments)

*** The obj_size() method was done to address a review comment from
    Clay (clayg), but it is only called when the file has already been
    open (HEAD and GET requests).

    I am not convinced of such generalizations yet. I think the better
    think to do here is to make the constructor be a simple setup with
    no on disk state reads/writes, and add methods to request the read
    / write behaviors.

    Keeping this work-in-progress for now as a comparison to other
    efforts by community members.

Change-Id: I21b2b909a13ed5e497b06fee37db09738be03749
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor quarantine code removing get_data_file_size

Refactor the quarantine code to remove the get_data_file_size method,
recognizing that it was always called immediately following the
DiskFile contructed object. Now the DiskFile constructor has an
existence check behavior which folds those common patterns into the
constructor which now raises proper exceptions for those conditions.

*** The obj_size() method was done to address a review comment from
    Clay (clayg), but it is only called when the file has already been
    open (HEAD and GET requests).

    I am not convinced of such generalizations yet. I think the better
    think to do here is to make the constructor be a simple setup with
    no on disk state reads/writes, and add methods to request the read
    / write behaviors.

    Keeping this work-in-progress for now as a comparison to other
    efforts by community members.

Change-Id: I21b2b909a13ed5e497b06fee37db09738be03749
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

I use the files from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20459/21 and start the neutron servers and change the endpoint in keystone. run this patch:
gongysh@gongysh-ThinkPad-T530:~/test$ neutron net-list --os-cacert /mnt/data/gongysh/test/certificate.crt
SSL certificate validation has failed: [Errno 1] _ssl.c:504: error:14090086:SSL routines:SSL3_GET_SERVER_CERTIFICATE:certificate verify failed
gongysh@gongysh-ThinkPad-T530:~/test$ neutron net-list --os-cacert /mnt/data/gongysh/test/ca.crt
SSL certificate validation has failed: [Errno 1] _ssl.c:504: error:14094410:SSL routines:SSL3_READ_BYTES:sslv3 alert handshake failure"}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-07-23 13:11:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: (3 inline comments)

@gongysh

You must have set the 'ssl_ca_file' option, which turns on validation of client side SSL certificates (so that a server can check if a client is actually the person it claims to be). By default, the certificate from Python standard library (httplib) is used, which certainly is not signed by the CA cert, you use. That's why the client certificate validation fails and your server rejects connections. Comment this option and everything will be OK.

This patch has nothing to do with client side SSL certificates validation. Instead, it allows one to perform host side SSL certificates validation, so that python-neutronclient can connect to Neutron instances that listen for HTTPS connections and check, that those hosts are actually the ones they claim to be.

Client side SSL certificate validation is mostly useful for authenticating clients, while host side SSL certificates validation allows to run HTTP services using encrypted TCP connections.

Support of client SSL certificate setting varies among  python-*client projects:

 - python-novaclient and python-cinderclient don't allow one to set the client SSL certificate to be used

 - python-keystoneclient provides --os-cert option

 - python-glanceclient provides --cert-file option

...

So, client side SSL certificate validation is useful, but  implementation of corresponding CLI option should probably be done by another patch"}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-07-23 13:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-23 14:06:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Works for me

have tested, it is ok.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2013-07-25 14:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2013-07-30 04:00:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The Python 2.7.x ssl module doesn't perform any certificate verification. httplib and httplib2 are based on ssl and also do not perform certificate verification. This verification has been added in Python 3.2 but not backported to 2.7.

The requests module carries a backport of the Python 3.2 match_hostname() function and can replace for httplib2.

The solution is to swap httplib2 for requests in python-keystoneclient and enable it to verify server certificates. Ensure proper implementation of the command-line options to specify verification.

this is  what python-keystoneclient did before, so why don't we use requests in python-neutronclient"}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-07-30 04:44:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

@Yaguang

I tested this code and I believe it works correctly:

SSL certificate validation succeeds, if the given cert is correct (hostname matches, CA cert is provided) and up to date, and fails if the hostname doesn't match the one specified in the servert cert, or the server cert is outdated, or you haven't provided the CA cert.

Do you have half an hour to test this code? I could provide you the certificates I used for testing.

httplib2 actually provides a function for validation of certificate hostname:

    def _ValidateCertificateHostname(self, cert, hostname):
        """Validates that a given hostname is valid for an SSL certificate.

        Args:
          cert: A dictionary representing an SSL certificate.
          hostname: The hostname to test.
        Returns:
          bool: Whether or not the hostname is valid for this certificate.
        """
        hosts = self._GetValidHostsForCert(cert)
        for host in hosts:
            host_re = host.replace('.', '\.').replace('*', '[^.]*')
            if re.search('^%s$' % (host_re,), hostname, re.I):
                return True
        return False

I agree, that requests is a modern and good solution, but switching from httplib2 to requests is probably a task for another blueprint.'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2013-07-30 04:55:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16: No score

Roman,

it's reasonable to change httplib2 to requests, I agree that we can first make ssl  works."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-07-31 00:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

commit_message:
Handle host side SSL certificates validation

 - add --os-cacert option which allows to set a file containing
   certificates of root CAs (certificate authorities) that are
   required for validation of HTTPS servers SSL certificates

 - wrap httplib2 SSL certificates validation errors with a
   custom quantumclient exception

Blueprint: quantum-client-ssl

Change-Id: I4e6a7d177ba14314ba9bed613ec2684bffc35222

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 21:38:37.000000000', 'message': "Add more info to delete error message.

Our cases for what we allow delete on are limited, this is
fine, however we should log the status of a volume that we
are unable to delete so there's some feed-back as to exactly
why the delete call failed.

Change-Id: I95a9584d4875e188024be13bb53246be63c72374
"}]
commit_message:
Add more info to delete error message.

Our cases for what we allow delete on are limited, this is
fine, however we should log the status of a volume that we
are unable to delete so there's some feed-back as to exactly
why the delete call failed.

Change-Id: I95a9584d4875e188024be13bb53246be63c72374

commit_message:
Updating HACKING file

Using OpenStack HACKING file for common stuff and mentioning locals()
disallowed now like Cinder.

Change-Id: I05b1706eb52c13b9eb89fe5cbcce005c3cc75caf

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-30 22:20:29.000000000', 'message': '[xenapi] Unshadow an important test case class

A recent commit added a shadow of the VMOpsTestCase test class in
nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_vmops.py.  This renames the class to
eliminate the shadowing.  It also removes an unnecessary setUp()
method.

Fixes bug 1206703.

Change-Id: I6f36cea7d926c5773cfee1c5868c72acf56f3220
'}]
commit_message:
[xenapi] Unshadow an important test case class

A recent commit added a shadow of the VMOpsTestCase test class in
nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_vmops.py.  This renames the class to
eliminate the shadowing.  It also removes an unnecessary setUp()
method.

Fixes bug 1206703.

Change-Id: I6f36cea7d926c5773cfee1c5868c72acf56f3220

commit_message:
Add --security-group option to port-update

port-update --security_groups list=true ... is not user-friendly.

bug 1161078

This commit also changes the followings:
- Add --no-security-groups options to port-create for consistency.
- Make --security-group and --no-security-groups mutual-exclusive
  to prevent both options specified at the same time.

Change-Id: Ibfe165a0cbdfb0eb582784c80a3371de33108fdb

The metavariable for net-id was incorrectly set to `fixed_ip`.
This commit correctly sets the metavar to `net_id`.

Change-Id: I9bfb442af99848cf43d1f3b78967b785506ac54f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix net-id metavar for interface-attach

The metavariable for net-id was incorrectly set to `fixed_ip`.
This commit correctly sets the metavar to `net_id`.

Change-Id: I9bfb442af99848cf43d1f3b78967b785506ac54f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 06:41:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the help text process and the generated wrong help

The wrong help text of bash-completion is generated by the process of
choosing first line from the source code comment. We should get the all
help text from the source code comment, and use it.

So this commit removes this unnecessary process, and also fix the
README.rst for proper help text.

Fixes bug 1206005

Change-Id: Id4f5b6a7722197f09eb366ba8f3e643e1af91805

commit_message:
Fix the help text process and the generated wrong help

The wrong help text of bash-completion is generated by the process of
choosing first line from the source code comment. We should get the all
help text from the source code comment, and use it.

So this commit removes this unnecessary process, and also fix the
README.rst for proper help text.

Fixes bug 1206005

Change-Id: Id4f5b6a7722197f09eb366ba8f3e643e1af91805

subject: fix swift i18n
messages:
[{'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-07-30 20:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I actually want this WIP'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-07-30 20:04:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

just trying to validate approach'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-07-31 00:05:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So I looked at openstack.common.gettextutils and discussed with mordred and it is probably not the right thing for swift right now.

1) it may be a library "soon", so jumping on oslo-incubator update.py openstack-common.conf may not be worth it in *this* case
2) it depends on "six" for something else that it does; which we don't need - so it'd be "copied"* olso code AND a new dependency just to get the 4 lines of python that do what we want.

 * olso's update script doesn't actually just "copy" code, it re-writes it in place as it's copying it.  gettextutils has an example of this where one of the constants defined in the module is different from what is *written* in oslo-incubator/openstack/common/gettextutils.py and what ultimately ends up in swift/openstack/common/gettextutils.py

I think this patch as it stands is our best bet and making swift work with locale environment vars again - but I guess I'll have to go change all of the "from gettext import gettext as _" to "from swift import gettext_ as _"

I probably will do it with sed rather than picking them up and moving them from stdlib imports down near the swift imports (anyone have some sed foo that could do this?)'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-07-31 00:23:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

moved to https://review.openstack.org/39391'}]

[{'created': '2013-07-30 23:39:58.000000000', 'message': 'Adds Support for X-Forwarded-For HTTP Headers

Previously, the nova::api class did not support proxies and
load-balancers that use X-Forwarded-For Headers to identify the
originating IP address of requests.  This change implements the
use_forwarded_for parameter to enable/disable the ability for
Nova API to treat the X-Forwarded-For HTTP Header as the canonical
remote address.

Defaults to false for backwards compatibility and to disable
X-Forwarded-For Headers.

Change-Id: I3c7224bef1bfa4578ab2a298b05a24e46d618ce7
'}]
commit_message:
Adds Support for X-Forwarded-For HTTP Headers

Previously, the nova::api class did not support proxies and
load-balancers that use X-Forwarded-For Headers to identify the
originating IP address of requests.  This change implements the
use_forwarded_for parameter to enable/disable the ability for
Nova API to treat the X-Forwarded-For HTTP Header as the canonical
remote address.

Defaults to false for backwards compatibility and to disable
X-Forwarded-For Headers.

Change-Id: I3c7224bef1bfa4578ab2a298b05a24e46d618ce7

commit_message:
Separate NVP create lport operation and neutron db transaction

Bug 1200001

This patch removes the NVP call for creating a logical port from
the SQL transaction context used for creating the Neutron port.
It also ensures orphaned data are properly removed from both
the Neutron DB and the NVP backend.

Change-Id: I028a1493ecf732f2422e0eaa2020bac4ebdbb457

commit_message:
For Fn::Join, replace None items with an empty string.

Currently, attempts to join lists with None items results in an error.

This change is required for the next attempt to fix bug: #1184794

Change-Id: Ib599eeb21b7325ff797768100f1556a424a8bde9
(cherry picked from commit 85b363342c0d3a25155c500b42810f9ef9d82a22)

commit_message:
Include pipeline option for using identity headers

There have been patches in nova, glance client and glance
registry to give the user the option of not reauthenticating
in glance. Below are the related reviews. This patch
provides pipeline options the users will want to use for the same.

Nova: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37070/
Glanceclient: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37062/
Glance Registry: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/36563/

Change-Id: I904f8bafb7e5abceac5723ed8504c672a00c5ec7

commit_message:
Logging virtual size of the QCOW2

When we boot VM with QCOW2 which virtual size of the QCOW2 is larger than
flavor's root disk size, we cannot know virtual size in the log.

Virtual size of the QCOW2 should be logged.

Change-Id: I3ed969151525cada2208f755b0116ed0eca1bdf2
Fixes: bug #1206362

commit_message:
Add default route to dhcp agent netns.

Remove code block "if self.conf.enable_metadata_network:". No need to treat it
differently. Default route will be set as any other network.

Change-Id: I71eaaf46bbd01f577988211b650fdbe3972d1fa0
Fixes: bug #1196889

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-30 14:39:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix timing issue in SimpleTenantUsageSample test

If POST query, which is made in test setUp(), for some reason
takes more that 1 second to proceed (e. g. high LA value), the
test will fail due to mismatch between the expected and actual
instance uptime values.

The error is quite rare, but nevertheless happens time to time
when Jenkins runs gate jobs.

Fixes bug 1206526

Change-Id: I0418ee3f852db6dd3c5ed905490be2e48c8fd0ba
'}]
commit_message:
Fix timing issue in SimpleTenantUsageSample test

If POST query, which is made in test setUp(), for some reason
takes more that 1 second to proceed (e. g. high LA value), the
test will fail due to mismatch between the expected and actual
instance uptime values.

The error is quite rare, but nevertheless happens time to time
when Jenkins runs gate jobs.

Fixes bug 1206526

Change-Id: I0418ee3f852db6dd3c5ed905490be2e48c8fd0ba

[{'created': '2013-07-17 23:08:57.000000000', 'message': "sql.Driver:authenticate() signatures should match

A method called authenticate_user was renamed in
identity.backends.sql.Driver from authenticate_user
to authenticate but the base class wasn't updated.

Also, the user_id and password arguments to authenticate
should NOT be optional.

Change-Id: Ie6eb42f060e368ec99d5d8241a404cf7c70d48ae
"}]
commit_message:
sql.Driver:authenticate() signatures should match

A method called authenticate_user was renamed in
identity.backends.sql.Driver from authenticate_user
to authenticate but the base class wasn't updated.

Also, the user_id and password arguments to authenticate
should NOT be optional.

Change-Id: Ie6eb42f060e368ec99d5d8241a404cf7c70d48ae

Change-Id: I0db9cc18fda98b8f53b61422e730fd76e0c6a0c1

commit_message:
Remove missing_reuqires optimization

The attempt to optimize away some shell calls to pip wound up having
python setup.py install not do the right thing with missing transitive
depends. Remove the optimization check.

Change-Id: I0db9cc18fda98b8f53b61422e730fd76e0c6a0c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 19:12:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add locking to test_aggregates

There is a race condition when running testr in parallel between
the XML and JSON versions of:

test_aggregate_add_host_create_server_with_az

because a host can only be in one availability zone at a time. This
commit adds file locking to that test using oslo lockutils so that
the XML and JSON tests will never run at the same time.

part of blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: I1ce76ccd9c57d8f44f19958498c632910112528b

commit_message:
Add locking to test_aggregates

There is a race condition when running testr in parallel between
the XML and JSON versions of:

test_aggregate_add_host_create_server_with_az

because a host can only be in one availability zone at a time. This
commit adds file locking to that test using oslo lockutils so that
the XML and JSON tests will never run at the same time.

part of blueprint speed-up-tempest

Change-Id: I1ce76ccd9c57d8f44f19958498c632910112528b

commit_message:
Manually mock service_catalog in stub_keystoneclient

MockObject.__init__ ignores properties, fixes:

FAIL: test_get_default_role (openstack_dashboard.test.api_tests.keystone_tests.RoleAPITests)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/lib/openstack-dashboard-test/openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/keystone_tests.py", line 78, in test_get_default_role
    keystoneclient = self.stub_keystoneclient()
  File "/var/lib/openstack-dashboard-test/openstack_dashboard/test/helpers.py", line 287, in stub_keystoneclient
    self.keystoneclient = self.mox.CreateMock(keystone_client.Client)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/site-packages/mox.py", line 258, in CreateMock
    new_mock = MockObject(class_to_mock, attrs=attrs)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/site-packages/mox.py", line 556, in __init__
    attr = getattr(class_to_mock, method)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/site-packages/mox.py", line 608, in __getattr__
    raise UnknownMethodCallError(name)
UnknownMethodCallError: Method called is not a member of the object: service_catalog
>>  raise UnknownMethodCallError('service_catalog')

(cherry picked from commit 82bdecb117877bc0bd1bbd553fbd40d04cbe9078)

Temporary change the django_openstack_auth requirement

The new django_openstack_auth version causes gate job issues like:
http://logs.openstack.org/33618/5/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/29950/console.html

Temporary disabling the 1.1.0 version.

(from commit 2ffe032dbf21757bd574dedffa3cd3f6927bbfe3)

Mock some more keystoneclient.Client properties for mox

Fixes LP bug 1196823

(cherry picked from commit 2a6d669443b817ced3a98f5bc60a066298b6e40e)

Sync pytz from requirements.txt

pip 1.4 is imminent, and doesn't install pre-release versions if you
don't ask for them - this includes the date-based version of pytz.

Grizzly: cherry-picked from commits 82bdecb117, 2ffe032dbf, 2a6d669443, 5abe67709c
Folsom: cherry-picked from commits 47ea6801e9, a1b23d62cd31

Conflicts:
	tools/pip-requires

Change-Id: I9b0c56eda95ee83cf56a28f2f1b7316ad2592fa2

commit_message:
Enable client library V2 to create an image.

Adds support for creating an image to the client library only, not the CLI.
Replaced reference to deprecated BaseException.message

Related to bp glance-client-v2

Change-Id: I8e3d09d89493368d22f7b1f69f79ebd2518e289d

commit_message:
Fixed Cinder volume creation via Heat; backport of test_volume unit tests

The handle_create method in heat/engine/resources/volume.py was missing
an availabilty_zone definition. If no default availability_zone had been
set in Cinder, volume creation would fail.

Master appears to have code to include availability_zone, but the
changes seem non-trival to backport. Discussed with zaneb and shardy;
was recommended to attempt to propose fix to stable/grizzly.

Including commit amendment that attempts to backport unit tests from
master (134b11ccd145f982b7173bc9a5d0f1bc3e8eef8c).

Change-Id: Ib3a330777e91a20451c6736655a9236412139cf2
Fixes: bug #1206276

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-19 08:54:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to make probetests more brittle

Currently probetests take advantage of a number of assumptions about the SUT.
Unfortunately after some time with a working SAIO, configuration drift may
result in a system that is no longer compatible with these assumptions.  To
help weary developers more quickly identify the changes they've made since
they last ran probetests successfully, some handy validators have been added
to test.probe.common

Additionally a new option 'validate_rsync' in test.conf, when enabled, will
run a series of up front validations during the setup of each probetest by
inspecting the ring, the mounted devices, and the rsync exports ("modules") in
order to ensure that when probetests fail the do so early and with specific
complaints.

To preserve existing failures, the option is disabled by default.

Change-Id: I2be11c7e67ccd0bc0589c360c170049b6288c152
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to make probetests more brittle

Currently probetests take advantage of a number of assumptions about the SUT.
Unfortunately after some time with a working SAIO, configuration drift may
result in a system that is no longer compatible with these assumptions.  To
help weary developers more quickly identify the changes they've made since
they last ran probetests successfully, some handy validators have been added
to test.probe.common

Additionally a new option 'validate_rsync' in test.conf, when enabled, will
run a series of up front validations during the setup of each probetest by
inspecting the ring, the mounted devices, and the rsync exports ("modules") in
order to ensure that when probetests fail the do so early and with specific
complaints.

To preserve existing failures, the option is disabled by default.

Change-Id: I2be11c7e67ccd0bc0589c360c170049b6288c152

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-23 14:14:46.000000000', 'message': 'Obscure the X-Auth-Token in proxy log

The X-Auth-Token is sensitive data. If revealed to an unauthozied person,
they can now make requests against an account until the token expires.

This implementation maintains current behavior (i.e, the token
is logged). Implementers can choose to set reveil_sensitive_prefix
to (e.g.) 12 so only first 12 characters of the token are logged.
Or, set to 0 to completely remove the token.

DocImpact

Part of bug #1004114

Change-Id: Iecefa843d8f9ef59b9dcf0860e7a4d0e186a6cb5

commit_message:
Obscure the X-Auth-Token in proxy log

The X-Auth-Token is sensitive data. If revealed to an unauthozied person,
they can now make requests against an account until the token expires.

This implementation maintains current behavior (i.e, the token
is logged). Implementers can choose to set reveal_sensitive_prefix
to (e.g.) 12 so only first 12 characters of the token are logged.
Or, set to 0 to replace the token with "...".

DocImpact

Part of bug #1004114

Change-Id: Iecefa843d8f9ef59b9dcf0860e7a4d0e186a6cb5

commit_message:
Add environmental variables to test.conf

This commit adds environmental variables to .testr.conf to disable
testr capturing STDOUT and STDERR by default. So now STDOUT and
STDERR will print immediately by default when using testr. It also
adds a default 250 sec timeout for tests. If a test takes longer than
this it will fail.

Change-Id: I32d8b1a856f6e7932d16b1464553e9c25fbc3cfc

around this by catching the exception and printing a warn message to
the log.

Fixes bug 1204598

Change-Id: I5f872c7ac89334fc3914906831ed8f2a58881543
'}, {'created': '2013-07-27 03:13:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race between aggregate list and delete

Previously, during get_aggregate_list() if an aggregate was deleted
after the list of aggregates is initially pulled from the database
then it will error out and the api request will receive a 404
response. However the db call that used to get the list of aggregates
contained all the required information for the response list. This
commit parses the response of db.get_aggregate_get() and formats it
in the same format as _get_aggregates_info() instead of calling
_get_aggregates_info() for each aggregate. This fixes the race
condition by only making one database call instead of making an
additional two for each aggregate.

Fixes bug 1204598

Change-Id: I5f872c7ac89334fc3914906831ed8f2a58881543

'}, {'created': '2013-07-28 17:08:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race between aggregate list and delete

Previously, during get_aggregate_list() if an aggregate was deleted
after the list of aggregates is initially read from the database
with db.get_aggregate_all() then the list method would raise an
AggregateNotFound when it called _get_aggregates_info(), which makes
additional db queries for each aggregate. This would result in the api
request receiving a 404 response. However db.get_aggregate_all()
already contained all the required information for the aggregate
list.

This commit changes get_aggregate_list() to correctly parses the
response of db.get_aggregate_get() and formats its response in the
same way as _get_aggregates_info() would return. This avoids calling
_get_aggregates_info() for each aggregate which fixes the race
condition by only making one database read for a list operation.

Fixes bug 1204598

Change-Id: I5f872c7ac89334fc3914906831ed8f2a58881543
'}, {'created': '2013-07-29 18:12:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race between aggregate list and delete

Previously, during get_aggregate_list() if an aggregate was deleted
after the list of aggregates is initially read from the database
with db.get_aggregate_all() then the list method would raise an
AggregateNotFound when it called _get_aggregates_info(), which makes
additional db queries for each aggregate. This would result in the api
request receiving a 404 response. However db.get_aggregate_all()
already contained all the required information for the aggregate
list.

This commit changes _get_aggregate_info() to just correctly parse the
response of db.get_aggregate_get() and formats its response in the
same way as _get_aggregates_info() would return with the extra
database queries. This fixes the race condition not only in list but
potentially in other calls by only making one database read for any
get operation.

Fixes bug 1204598

Change-Id: I5f872c7ac89334fc3914906831ed8f2a58881543

with get_aggregate_list() and to ensure that we don't change the

commit_message:
Fix race between aggregate list and delete

Previously, during get_aggregate_list() if an aggregate was deleted
after the list of aggregates is initially read from the database
with db.get_aggregate_all() then the list method would raise an
AggregateNotFound when it called _get_aggregates_info(), which makes
additional db queries for each aggregate. This would result in the api
request receiving a 404 response. However db.get_aggregate_all()
already contained all the required information for the aggregate
list.

This commit changes renames _get_aggregate_info() to
_reformat_aggregate_info() which just correctly parse the response of
db.get_aggregate_get() and formats its response in the same way as
_get_aggregates_info() would return with the extra database queries.
This fixes the race condition not only in list but potentially in
other calls by only making one database read for any get operation.

Also, the unit tests added in this commit are to fill a coverage gap
with get_aggregate_list() and to ensure that we don't change the
behavior of list while fixing the race condition. The race condition
is not directly testable in unit tests because it requires a
multithreaded environment to send a delete immediately after a list
call. It was uncovered by running tempest in parallel with testr.

Fixes bug 1204598

Change-Id: I5f872c7ac89334fc3914906831ed8f2a58881543

commit_message:
Raise exception if both port and fixed-ip are in requested networks.

When both fixed-ip and port (uuid) are specified as part of the
request during server creation, the user specified fixed-ip must
be ignored because it has already been allocated for the port. For
compute osapi v3, we raise a BadRequest Exception to ensure the user
understands why he/she is not getting what he/she asks for.

This patch also address some minor nits in other error messages.

Fixed bug #1190777

Change-Id: Iaf606637a8acf9d20fc6cae0bed5c9a3ea0bf611

commit_message:
Switch to using Oslo logging

This commit removes the tempest.common.log module and switches to
using the Oslo log module. The Oslo log module is required by
lockutils and it's dependent modules, so this patch migrates all of
Tempest to it so that there is only one logger in the project. This
also has the advantage of bringing Tempest's logging configuration
in line with other OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: I31b460e454123a4211c0a8a1dc91bbfd562ce81a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-30 17:40:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix neutron cli tests skip for testr

The manner in which a skip exception was raised in the neutron cli
tests would cause the tests to be listed as fail when run with testr.
This commit corrects the behavior so that testr will correctly mark
the test as skipped instead of failed.

Change-Id: I9680b6946b44eeab9a0e6c5b9b4609e702880f07
'}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron cli tests skip for testr

The manner in which a skip exception was raised in the neutron cli
tests would cause the tests to be listed as fail when run with testr.
This commit corrects the behavior so that testr will correctly mark
the test as skipped instead of failed.

Change-Id: I9680b6946b44eeab9a0e6c5b9b4609e702880f07

add doc/source/api in gitignore

Some files are created after running 'python setup.py build_sphinx'.
These should be ignored by git

Change-Id: I89d671d84294169dac5aacf18800ab805605aa9f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-30 18:03:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add force_config_drive option to nova.conf.

Allow the force_config_drive option to be set to allow
config_drive to be used as an additional meta-data source
by supported images.

Defaults to false to match the existing nova default.

Change-Id: I2d3e26da484cd0895ceab77aa200e5cf5943a065
'}]
commit_message:
Add force_config_drive option to nova.conf.

Allow the force_config_drive option to be set to allow
config_drive to be used as an additional meta-data source
by supported images.

Defaults to false to match the existing nova default.

Change-Id: I2d3e26da484cd0895ceab77aa200e5cf5943a065

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-30 01:15:02.000000000', 'message': 'Eliminate can_delete_db

The method can_delete_db() appears to be not only unused, but has
always been so. I verified this going back to Austin release. It is
very strange that we never noticed it until now, but here it is.

Change-Id: I4445c4b2c4721f880c9dbb1eac055c0601ae6372
'}]
commit_message:
Eliminate can_delete_db

The method can_delete_db() appears to be not only unused, but has
always been so. I verified this going back to Austin release. It is
very strange that we never noticed it until now, but here it is.

Change-Id: I4445c4b2c4721f880c9dbb1eac055c0601ae6372

commit_message:
Set default wsgi workers to cpu_count

Change the default value of wsgi workers from 1 to auto.  The new default
value for workers in the proxy, container, account & object wsgi servers will
spawn as many workers per process as you have cpu cores.

This will not be ideal for some configurations, but it's much more likely to
produce a successful out of the box deployment.

Inspect the number of cpu_cores using python's multiprocessing when available.
Multiprocessing was added in python 2.6, but I know I've compiled python
without it before on accident.  The cpu_count method seems to be pretty system
agnostic, but it says it can raise NotImplementedError or sometimes return 0.

Add a new utility method 'config_auto_int_value' to pull an integer out of the
config which has a dynamic default.

 * drive by s/container/proxy/ in proxy-server.conf.5
 * fix misplaced max_clients in *-server.conf-sample
 * update doc/development_saio to force workers = 1

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ifa563d22952c902ab8cbe1d339ba385413c54e95

commit_message:
Initialize resources to DELETE-COMPLETE if missing during stack delete

If the parent stack is being deleted and a given resource cannot be found in
the data store, initialize its state to DELETE:COMPLETE instead of
INIT:COMPLETE.

fixes bug 1204268

Change-Id: I5074d63928c3b39fe6ad85dc6af1d02db777acc8

commit_message:
Use tempest log with tempest/openstack/common/lockutils.py

tempest.common.log is specilaized for argparse less logging
configuration, so it should be used by unittests.

Change-Id: I07f2d94bd5652aed9f97241a3272b11a8a75785d

1) On my system eventlet already calls the app_iter's close in handle_one_response.  GC might clean up the open file handle, but it wouldn't have run the quarantine check code.

2) Strange that __iter__ and app_iter_ranges both do the close in a finally block but not app_iter_range.  In those cases when the wsgi server goes to close the response it just jumps over the if self.fp block and falls out.  Should app_iter_range's close happen in a finally block too?"}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-07-30 16:59:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I can move it to a finally block for consistency, sure.'}, {'account_id': 7680, 'date': '2013-07-30 17:00:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-07-30 17:02:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-07-30 17:19:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

It's interesting that __iter__ might leave the file open, while app_iter_ranges() will never leave it open.

I don't think it matters in this case, as WSGI should .close() the iterator when it's done, and DiskFile.close() unconditionally closes things. Makes me wonder what app_iter_ranges() is getting up to that it won't keep the file open if you ask... we probably just don't have any callers that require the file to remain open.

Anyhow, I think it's fine."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-30 17:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
When iterating over a range of a file, always close it

This is needed on Pythons without reference counting garbage collectors (e.g.
PyPy).

Change-Id: I1d06eb8fe08ee6eeb45caa47b653d6af0bb18267

Fixes bug 1206256

In Python 2.6 xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring raises
xml.parsers.expat.ExpatError instead of
xml.etree.ElementTree.ParseError when faced with invalid xml.

commit_message:
Make middleware.py Python 2.6 compatible

Fixes bug 1206256

In Python 2.6 xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring raises
xml.parsers.expat.ExpatError instead of
xml.etree.ElementTree.ParseError when faced with invalid xml.
This change catches an import error and uses ExpatError instead of
ParseError.

Change-Id: I8ab41328c8eeacc28f4e01d730c73ff251df4a25

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: (28 inline comments)

although there are more comments inline, there are a few bits that I was unable to understand:

- how APIs manage firewall rules (as a list in FirewallPolicy, standalone objects, both)
- what we can do with a rule which is not bound to any policy, and how can we bind an unbound rule
- the concept of 'shared' firewall
- rule ordering (I don't even understand if we want to have this or not)


Also the current plugin module does not seem to have a lot of sense without the agent. It's more of a mock at the moment. I would consider delaying it in a different patch which includes the agent as well.

Before reviewing, I've tried to catch up with mailing list and design documents. However, it's likely I've missed something and so you'll find me either stating the obvious or writing dumb thing. Apologies in advance in that case."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: (1 inline comment)

* The empty directories in this patch will be removed. It was just meant as a guidance for the dependent patches (agent and driver) while they are being worked on.

* All relevant unit tests for this code will be in this patch itself. Some are still missing, and will be added.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: (14 inline comments)

Addressed Akihiro and Salvatore's comments (thanks for the detailed review). In addition, this particular patch introduces the following new features:

* ip_version attribute for firewall_rule (4 versus 6)

* source_port and destination_port for firewall_rule can now be either a single port or a port range (in the format 'p1:p2'). If its a single port, both integer and string values are accepted, if its a range it has to be a string. Ports in DB will always be stored as a string

* source/destination_ip_address for firewall_rule can either be a single ip address or a subnet (this facilitates specifying multiple ip addresses)"}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

fw/firewalls
