revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-06 16:06:39.000000000', 'message': 'Implement l3 agent dual-NAT mode support

blueprint l3-dual-nat-mode

With dual-NAT mode enabled, each router has a 'private' gateway port,
which is not maintained by Quantum. All those gateway ports of the routers
in a l3 agent are bridged to br-ex and belong to the same local subnet
(e.g. 169.254.4.0/24). The subnet's gateway is another tap device in the
network node host and bridged to br-ex as well. There will be two NAT ops
when a VM accesses outside network, one is between tenant network and
"private" subnet, the other is between "private" subnet and dest netowrk.

Duan-NAT mode could bring two benefits:
* Reduce the usage of public IP address
* VMs can access all the networks that can be accessed by network node host

Change-Id: I06cd2d2c0db0a8bef0c4c878d462ee276e1c862c

commit_message:
Implement l3 agent dual-NAT mode support

blueprint l3-dual-nat-mode

With dual-NAT mode enabled, each router has a 'private' gateway port,
which is not maintained by Quantum. All those gateway ports of the
routersin a l3 agent are bridged to br-ex and belong to the same
local subnet (e.g. 169.254.4.0/24). The subnet's gateway is another
tap device in the network node host and bridged to br-ex as well.
There will be two NAT ops when a VM accesses outside network, one is
between tenant network and "private" subnet, the other is between
"private" subnet and dest netowrk.

Dual-NAT mode could bring two benefits:
* Reduce the usage of public IP address, especially if muti-host
  feature is available
* VMs can access all networks could be accessed by network node host

Change-Id: I06cd2d2c0db0a8bef0c4c878d462ee276e1c862c

commit_message:
Add EC2 tags API to euca tests

The EC2 tags API was added to nova (nova commit 55a04a4bc3). This test
creates a tag, verifies it, deletes it, and verifies that it's gone.

Fixes bug #1194361

Change-Id: I5332932d97ad7fdc71a020acc4b9369354d03537

'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-07-21 23:51:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I don't like it. (not your work, but having to live with passing two sets of parameters around). I still feel the way to approach this is to have a way of passing warnings back to the user (soft failures), but I'd rather live with hard failures."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-07-22 05:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zane, just adding you for you POV.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-07-22 09:12:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am in two minds about this, so +0.

On the one hand, at the moment we are throwing away information (i.e. the source of the parameter value) in the API, and that doesn't seem like a good policy in general.

On the other hand, neither am I a huge fan either of modifying the environment by adding an extra field to it before passing it to the engine.

Angus, how would you feel about just passing the parameters and environment unmodified as separate arguments to the RPC stack_create? There will come a time when backwards compatibility of the RPC API is important, but now is not that time. What we're currently doing with passing either the user params (cfn API) or the environment (native API) in the same field and trying to determine later which it was (which, btw, will break horribly if the user supplies a param called "parameters" to the cfn-api) is at least as bad anything in this patch. We could probably even default the environment argument to {}, so cfn-api wouldn't have to change.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-30 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-30 06:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
resolve clashes between params validation and environment

Defer the merge of user-parameters and user-environment-parameters
until the Pamameter construction time.

Fixes bug #1201688

Change-Id: I2b5254df6ad39c94819181bd105dfe5e6300ca18

commit_message:
Add Quantum LBaaS support in Horizon

- This patch enable the user to activate Load-Balancing management
from Horizon with enable_lb flag.
- Also, it replace quantum flag by quantum_lbaas (quantum flag is deprecated).

Change-Id: I91b6505aff642703a71d1180f57ecb2d8c9eae65

By that logic, my first contribution would not have been merged at all. (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9106/). Isn't there value in getting a new contributor to chip away at some of the locals() usage in nova, instead of driving them away from the community?"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-15 20:36:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sean,

The absolute size of a patch isn't what matters.  Its that this a big bug, and breaking it down into pieces that are too small is a waste of time. In your first fix you fixed  the entire scope of the 'bug'.  As this bug is huge 16 lines barely makes a dent in the issue."}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-07-16 11:57:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Joe, please reconsider your opinion.
I think it makes more sense to quickly approve the fix (in case the code is good) for such simple issue than to make author to reiterate and trigger another rounds of reviews.

Initially I've sent a couple of patches for this bug and I know other people have sent patches of different size as well.
Since not all string formatting has been cleaned up at this moment it makes sense to avoid concurrent patches. For instance, I would not want to check what has been covered by Vandita's patch and what's not. Neither I want to take away the opportunity to contribute."}, {'account_id': 8238, 'date': '2013-07-23 04:07:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Looks solid and very cool she volunteered her time to contribute these fixes.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-30 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-07-30 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

Fixes bug 1171936

commit_message:
Parse error object (in json format) returned by heat-api

With this fix, heatclient will display a clear error message when
encounter an server-side error. Additionally, the corresponding
traceback will be displayed when "--verbose" is set.

Change-Id: I99b828465f61478a3c63fcf549d044a62523be1f

commit_message:
Removed unnecessary monkeypatching of __builtin__

Replaced it with explicitly importing the gettext function, which is
significantly more readable.

Change-Id: Ia0a7edcf685fb6e4052a8290367b233169529ab8

commit_message:
Improve monitoring coverage in nagios3 element.

The current nagios element is provides only ping and ssh monitoing.

This patch adds a dependency on the snmpd elemet in order to provide
SNMP and SNMPD services to the Nagios host.

Adds several Nagios check scripts and configuration files to improve
the overall monitoring of cloud hosts.

17-nagios files moved to 60-nagios so that they run after other ORC
scripts from dependent elements.

Change-Id: I1f29075cb18b84da7450b1b098828feab4be8d6e
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Clean up pass-through logic in update.py

In our gating logic (project-requirements-change.py), we ignore
tarballs, editable reqs and --find-links lines. Similarly, in update.py
we just want to pass these through on unmodified.

Add a _pass_through() function which encapsulates this logic and use it
to ignore lines when parsing the source requirements.txt and also to
pass-through matching lines from the destination requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I7c34dd65ecd866e923c117686d10e86177bb320e

commit_message:
Correct the 3PAR SSH connection IP address details

The patch fixes the bug that referenced the Service processor instead
of the storage system IP address when making a SSH connection.

Change-Id: Ie81f2337f1da5a01b6d2111f9815b70128777d6d
Fixes: bug #1206133

It's not totally obvious to me how to test this condition exterally (I guess I could monkeypatch the module to use the stdlib json, in addition to whatever default tests it runs). Would you like me to pursue that avenue, or is the fact that it fails reliably under a different json encoder enough?"}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2013-07-26 22:28:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Encode unicode from JSON before using it as a string.

Right now this code fails when used with a JSON
decoder that always produces unicode. This isn't
usually the case with CPython, where simplejson
is used most of the time, however with the stdlib
JSON library (as used on PyPy), this code fails.

Change-Id: Ib2343243f40194d5b2784551a807c7f58970a6e9

commit_message:
Tests for out of range integers

This patch adds tests for,
1. out of range integers in the JSON request
body. Refer https://trello.com/c/0anf1cMf/331-json-integer-overflowerror.
2. negative integers in grace & TTL for claims.

Tests: bug #1202846

Change-Id: I100911edf20701b16bee31949fde65148e8e4e01

[{'created': '2013-07-29 09:13:14.000000000', 'message': 'fix UnicodeEncodeError raised in glance/store/base.py when system locale is non-ascii

if there has incorrect special configuration with any store in glance-api.conf,
glance-api will start failed and raise UnicodeEncodeError like this
"UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in position 0-7: ordinal not in range(128)"

Change-Id: If00c5047c1c53fb2474741f6d9db51fa001d5202
'}]
commit_message:
fix UnicodeEncodeError raised in glance/store/base.py when system locale is non-ascii

if there has incorrect special configuration with any store in glance-api.conf,
glance-api will start failed and raise UnicodeEncodeError like this
"UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode characters in position 0-7: ordinal not in range(128)"

Change-Id: If00c5047c1c53fb2474741f6d9db51fa001d5202

commit_message:
default token format/provider handling

The Keystone server would print a warning when both the token
format and provider were set to the default.

Also, the Keystone server would not start if the format was
commented out and the provider was set to the uuid.Provider.

Fixes: bug 1204314

Change-Id: Id7db33a1f27c4986af153efc73b22db8c6a8942e

"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-07-29 13:40:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Haomai Wang said:

 > Although it seems that the assert statements look well, I 
 > still want to emphasize the way isn't friendly. We should 
 > Consider reason below: 1. Nova is accepting a lot of 
 > patches every day and no one can guarantee that these 
 > assert statements will be destroyed. In a rare case, users 
 > want to see a friendly exception message instead of. 2. 
 > There exists rare cases such as memory corruption 3. 
 > Assert statement isn't accept at product codes

1. doesn't make any sense to me - the fact that we have some many contributors makes the assert I commented on even *more* useful, because it helps developers screw up the logic

As for user friendly exceptions, sure - I agree. Users should never see AssertionError

If you don't want assert statements executed at runtime, make sure to run with python -O - see e.g. http://docs.python.org/2/reference/simple_stmts.html#the-assert-statement"}, {'account_id': 6939, 'date': '2013-07-29 15:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Definitely a -1 from me
I am 100% agree with Mark McLoughlin. Assert is sometimes more friendly than exception.

An exception is trying to tell user "hey, you may do something wrong, check what you have done, then retry". While an assert, saying very clear "hey, something wrong on myself, try to restart me , or just go to fire a bug", user knows very clear that they didn't make any mistake before.

If someone(coder) break the assertion, it's likely the jenkins will complain druing check.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-07-29 22:22:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Do not merge

I agree with Mark'}, {'account_id': 7593, 'date': '2013-07-30 01:44:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2013-07-11 04:43:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove inappropriate assert() usage

Asserts should really only be used in tests. However, if there is a place in the
code where you know a given state should not be possible but perhaps could
happen (for example memory corruption) and you want to trap it in a known place
instead of letting it float through the system in less detectable places assert
can be used. It should be considered a debugging tool and not a way to validate
parameters.

There are few places in nova where asserts are used in inappropriate manner.

Fix bug #1199354

Change-Id: If98446de53c5a20e4025aaa12de431bf7a39ebd8

commit_message:
Remove inappropriate assert() usage

Asserts should really only be used in tests. However, if there is a place in
the code where you know a given state should not be possible but perhaps could
happen (for example memory corruption) and you want to trap it in a known place
instead of letting it float through the system in less detectable places assert
can be used. It should be considered a debugging tool and not a way to validate
parameters.

There are few places in nova where asserts are used in inappropriate manner.

Fix bug #1199354

Change-Id: If98446de53c5a20e4025aaa12de431bf7a39ebd8

commit_message:
Allow to run swift and keystone api tests standalone

Protect glance init using the config settings.

Change-Id: If8196dbbccd8dbb1ec9f8075d978608e7f709e99
Fixes: bug 1205923

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 15:56:34.000000000', 'message': "Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: I170b02bde2d3b93ddefb27452135dc09b23236de
"}]
commit_message:
Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: I170b02bde2d3b93ddefb27452135dc09b23236de

[{'created': '2013-07-23 20:56:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add isolated creds for glance and swift api tests

This commit adds isolated tenant support to both the swift and glance
api tests.

Change-Id: Ia22bd66006c010dcc4b57a6a6346b281086003d9
'}, {'created': '2013-07-23 21:34:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add tenant isolation for glance api tests

This commit adds isolated tenant support to the glance api tests. The
glance base test class is modified to call _get_isolated_creds() from
BaseTestCase if the isolated tenant config flag is set.

Change-Id: Ia22bd66006c010dcc4b57a6a6346b281086003d9
'}]
commit_message:
Add tenant isolation for glance api tests

This commit adds isolated tenant support to the glance api tests. The
glance base test class is modified to call _get_isolated_creds() from
BaseTestCase if the isolated tenant config flag is set.

Change-Id: Ia22bd66006c010dcc4b57a6a6346b281086003d9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-08 04:10:22.000000000', 'message': 'Reorganize url creation.

Make build_url extract used parameters from keyword arguments so they
are not sent as the body to create, or as query parameters.
Allow specifying a class level base_url that is used unless one is
specifically provided.
Break filtering function into a decorator as it seems the perfect
usecase and it prevents a dictionary copy.

Fixes: bug 1198772

commit_message:
Reorganize url creation.

Make build_url extract used parameters from keyword arguments so they
are not sent as the body to create, or as query parameters.
Allow specifying a class level base_url that is used unless one is
specifically provided.
Break filtering function into a decorator as it seems the perfect
usecase and it prevents a dictionary copy.

Fixes: bug 1198772
Change-Id: I6d370ed504c300b9997199f351322e3083650c69

commit_message:
xenapi: Uninstall instances

The devstack script sometimes failed to clean up the left over
instances. This patch will utilize the xe vm-uninstall force=true
command to get rid of the instances.

Change-Id: I3450e2d5c9a4b1fe8ede39c4cc5c337cd541ea35

commit_message:
Update OpenVZ driver image

11.10 simply does not exist, so this simply does not work. However,
devstack-gate tries to pre-cache all images referenced, so even though
we're not doing anything with this, it's breaking devstack-gate.

Change-Id: I64b03ed387f5205a885427498e8cf8c2a5b32b91

commit_message:
Fix various things when n-cell is enabled

1) Use the newer cell_type configuration option instead of overriding
the compute_api_class.

2) A nova-cells service is started for both the API cell (region) and
the compute cell (child).  The screen names were both 'n-cell' which
caused both services to log to the same log file.  The screen names have
been changed to n-cell-region and n-cell-child.

3) Security groups are not supported with cells.  Multiple exercises are
patched to use the 'default' security group instead of creating a new
one.  Additionally, if one uses the 'default' security group, do not try
to delete it, as one can never delete the default.

4) Disable the floating_ips and aggregates exercises when n-cell is
enabled, as they are not supported by cells.

5) Related to #4, disable the floating_ips tests within euca.sh

6) Update the README.md.  No services need to be disabled, and one only
needs to enable the n-cell service.

Change-Id: I9782d1e3cda3c9dd3daefa15c043f5b06473cb87

commit_message:
Ignore the default quota values

The default Quota values are just values from config file,
and they are usually different at ever cloud provider.

In the API compatibility perspective the values are not
important, but the keys presence is important.

The other option would be, adding the expected response to the
tempest config.

The test_get_updated_quotas test case also got a dedicated tenant.

Fixing bug 1130461
Change-Id: I50204dc7955d68491ad63f239c42fb47591a0be7

It is not fully clear to me.

 - I heard use the rest_clients in the api tests.
 - I heard do not use the rest_clients in the scenario or elsewhere.

I am even not sure what to use in the leakage tests..

Do you have a pro/contra list ?'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-07-22 14:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think there were a lot of people who want to use the official clients everywhere because it is easier and gives test coverage of the client. But we need to test the actual REST api. So we concluded (I think) that the tempest rest client should be used when actually testing the api, otherwise the official client. That would imply that the official client could be used for leak stuff.'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-07-22 14:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Understood, thanks for the explanation.
IMO the whitebox tests in this patch are actually API tests, as they validating return codes in specific scenarios. The only reason why they are whitebox rather than API in the folder structure is because they need direct access to the DB to setup the scenario under test.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-07-26 12:40:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Approved

commit_message:
Simplify whitebox/manager

* Allow the generic resource deletion (thing.delete) to
operate on resources allocated in the setUpClass-es too.

* test_images_whitebox.py is using the python
  client libraries as the scenario tests.

* Remove the not used part of the tempest/manager.py

Change-Id: I980a70d22dc7a3a65a26a8197c7888b125eb3b05

commit_message:
Handle a possible volume attachment visibility wait/race issue

The attached volume does not became necessarily immediately
visible on the guest even if the volume is in the 'in-use' state.
We may need to wait until it appears in the /proc/partitions
before any other action.

This patch also increase log verbosity, you will be able to see
 the actually visible partitions on the guest system.

Change-Id: I2b2d908b791d07066e5357ec0d213b953d5ce204

commit_message:
Unskip test_register_get_deregister_ari_image

wrong relative path handling, both issue has been fixed.
rong relative path handling, both issue has been fixed.

Add Neutron CLI tests to tempest

Checks return values and output of read-only commands.

commit_message:
Cherry pick from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/39115/,
Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: I3a05cb23bca5e77575e42e9d3cef49dc33918e8f

commit_message:
Use assertIn and assertNotIn instead of assertTrue/assertFalse

The assertIn and assertNotIn is defined in testtools, it is expected to
work with all testtools supported python version.

The assertIn and assertNotIn is more verbose when a real issue occurs.

Change-Id: I7a21a6e38f606deb58b5bade6414f6c4a4142f4b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 23:40:44.000000000', 'message': "Make H202 work again

I75c5cab81398f4cde5840b3b2082bd1f6ccb2661 broke H202, and made it check
for 'self.assertRaises(Exception)' instead of
'self.assertRaises(Exception,'

This fixes that, because this is essentially adding a new check this
requires a hacking 0.7 release.

Fixes bug 1206302

Change-Id: I7e7243a9937216c38093f6fd0ff983d50cfea5c4
"}]
commit_message:
Make H202 work again

I75c5cab81398f4cde5840b3b2082bd1f6ccb2661 broke H202, and made it check
for 'self.assertRaises(Exception)' instead of
'self.assertRaises(Exception,'

This fixes that, because this is essentially adding a new check this
requires a hacking 0.7 release.

Fixes bug 1206302

Change-Id: I7e7243a9937216c38093f6fd0ff983d50cfea5c4

commit_message:
Don't crash on tests when git is not installed

When running tests as part of packing the sdist'ed
tarball, we don't have git installed anymore.

Fixes LP Bug #1203187

Change-Id: I3fc603a57139d84aa8fb2b491c3a3196a4050ea9

[{'created': '2013-07-05 21:16:21.000000000', 'message': "Improve README, add CONTRIBUTING, parse version

The details:
- docs(README): add content, links, structure
- docs(CONTRIBUTING): add initial version - base off of marconi's
- refactor(setup): a few details...

    1. Autoparse version from README.rst - increase DRYness.
    2. Bump copyright year.
    3. Declare Python 3.3 support.

- fix(setup): add import re.

Change-Id: I6385c54ca09321d4a7e26f5821b9a4323264891b
"}, {'created': '2013-07-10 14:47:51.000000000', 'message': "Improve README, add CONTRIBUTING, parse version

The details:
- docs(README): add content, links, structure
- docs(CONTRIBUTING): add initial version - base off of marconi's
- refactor(setup): a few details...

    1. Autoparse version from README.rst - increase DRYness.
    2. Bump copyright year.
    3. Declare Python 3.3 support.

- fix(setup): add import re.
- fix(install): include README using MANIFEST.

Change-Id: I6385c54ca09321d4a7e26f5821b9a4323264891b
"}, {'created': '2013-07-10 16:24:47.000000000', 'message': "Improve README, add CONTRIBUTING, parse version

This improves the README, adds a CONTRIBUTING file, and automatically
parses the package version from the README.

The setup.py's copyright year has been bumped (2010 -> 2013) and the
declaration to support Python 3.3 is part of the classifiers.

Automatic version parsing depends on the README containing a string like:

:version: 1.2.3

This is accomplished using a regex, and by including the README as
part of the installation (MANIFEST.in).

Change-Id: I6385c54ca09321d4a7e26f5821b9a4323264891b
"}, {'created': '2013-07-10 16:45:31.000000000', 'message': "Improve README, add CONTRIBUTING, parse version

commit_message:
Improve README, add HACKING.

The HACKING file is taken almost verbatim from marconi.

The README adds many useful resources: links to Wiki, more prominent
version number, link to HACKING guide.

The setup.py's copyright year has been bumped (2010 -> 2013).

Change-Id: I6385c54ca09321d4a7e26f5821b9a4323264891b

Clean-up in the unit tests for NVP plugin

Simplify and reduce duplication in the unit test framework
for the NVP plugin.

Fixes bug 1204694

commit_message:
Add server resize command

* add server resize
* update --wait handling for server create, reboot, rebuild
* move _wait_for_status to utils

Blueprint: nova-client

Rebased after https://review.openstack.org/38162 was committed

Change-Id: I7a43b996feecadc7628fcfe20cd5b17333762739

commit_message:
Add function drop_unique_constraint()

We forgot to copy this function from nova, so we are not able to
switch to oslo sqlalchemy.utils until add this function.

Sqlalchemy doesn't supports some sqlite column types so we have no
possibility to drop unique constraint in general way on sqlite (we
loose these column types after migration).
Added unified drop_unique_constraint() function to drop unique
constraint for sql backends with tests.

blueprint: oslo-sqlalchemy-utils

Change-Id: I34000ad2277a97c31a29539d047faaf19876c9d5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-18 18:16:10.000000000', 'message': 'python3: Fix unicode compatibility

Python3 enforces the distinction between byte strings and text strings more rigorously than
python2. So use six.text_type, six.binary_types, and six.u where approiate.

Change-Id: I0a3e2c201412416352cf08bae40c770f39df9393
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
python3: Fix unicode compatibility

Python3 enforces the distinction between byte strings and text strings more rigorously than
python2. So use six.text_type, six.binary_types, and six.u where approiate.

Change-Id: I0a3e2c201412416352cf08bae40c770f39df9393
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: Add server commands: (un)lock, (un)rescue, (un)set, add/remove volume
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-25 20:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/98/38698/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-pep8/463 : SUCCESS in 1m 30s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/98/38698/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-docs/387/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 15s
- http://logs.openstack.org/98/38698/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-python26/455 : SUCCESS in 1m 34s
- http://logs.openstack.org/98/38698/1/check/gate-python-openstackclient-python27/459 : SUCCESS in 1m 13s
'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-07-27 21:07:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Overall very good; I noticed that some of the commands do not have any output. And some commands (like add volume or lock) would really benefit from the user from having some feedback.

Unless I'm getting ahead of myself and it's handled in novaclient."}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-07-27 21:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-29 15:24:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What output would you like to see?  The create commands need to report something new, add volume and lock have nothing new to report.  I also lean that way about those commands (like set) that make noise when nothing was asked of it: 'server set fred' should return nothing as nothing was asked and I don't see that as an error condition."}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2013-07-29 15:47:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I know what you mean; I ran into the same problem in 'add user to group' 

I'm just wondering if it's worth printing 'server updated - fred', if it works successfully. 

But on the other hand, I guess it's assumed it's always going to work, and if it does't the client should toss up an error?"}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-29 15:55:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

UNIX philosophy: no news is good news.  That works until we slip and some error happens and isn't reported.  I don't know of any of those ATM."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-07-29 23:21:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-29 23:23:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Add server commands: (un)lock, (un)rescue, (un)set, add/remove volume

* server lock/unlock, rescue/unrescue, set/unset
* add/remove volume

Blueprint: nova-client

Change-Id: I3709ecdb297ab15ad44df09d89af840164271a66

commit_message:
Make unicode-to-utf8 conversion universal in ceph backup driver.

librbd does not like unicode strings. A patch was
recently applied (c98cf2d8) to make all config
values utf8 but there are other areas of the ceph
backup driver where this also applies. This patch
adds a new method which converts strings to utf8
and replaces all relevant uses of str() with this
new conversion.

Change-Id: I8c3b01d1ea00b601c599396e3a662f172ffb9757
Fixes: bug #1206044

commit_message:
Remove fping plugin from V3 API

The fping extension, was introduced in
I7d942270aa52bd6216eda0d7ae366ef0195d52a8.  But this doesn't seem like a
good for nova-api.  We have no other 'instance monitoring' support in
nova and doing it out of the nova-api doesn't seem like the right place.

Change-Id: I3e9bd9b1c04aa06b62f1d3d82b0966e69829a620

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 20:28:57.000000000', 'message': 'Set tempest lock_path to default in $DATA_DIR

Change I464edf9e11710e1931ed4f7b0262328a57e5b3de set the tempest
lock_path to be $TMPDIR, however when run in the gate this is an
empty string which results in all tests that use locking failing.
This commit corrects that by setting the lock_path config variable
to use $TEMPEST_STATE_PATH which defaults to $DATA_DIR/tempest.

Change-Id: I02fbd50ca68d6daafb5b4c23579473eb703ae72a
'}]
commit_message:
Set tempest lock_path to default in $DATA_DIR

Change I464edf9e11710e1931ed4f7b0262328a57e5b3de set the tempest
lock_path to be $TMPDIR, however when run in the gate this is an
empty string which results in all tests that use locking failing.
This commit corrects that by setting the lock_path config variable
to use $TEMPEST_STATE_PATH which defaults to $DATA_DIR/tempest.

Change-Id: I02fbd50ca68d6daafb5b4c23579473eb703ae72a

commit_message:
Allow ::/0 for IPv6 security group rules

Nova fails to create a security group rule if ::/0 is used as
value for the cidr field

Fixes: LP bug #1199943
Cherry picked from https://review.openstack.org/36556

Change-Id: Ifce53dbc9f0740337921491aa752900892f47052
Signed-off-by: Rosario Di Somma <rosario.disomma@dreamhost.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 07:29:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix VMwareVCdriver reporting incorrect stats

fix bug #1180779

VMware nova compute drivers VMwareESXDriver and VMwareVCDriver
currently report stats for the column local_gb in MB instead of in GB
The fix would be to modify vmwareapi/host.py to ensure the values
reported for disk space are calculated in GB instead of MB.
Fix is done by further dividing the existing MB value by 1024 to
convert to GB.
The unit tests to check for capacity and freespace have been modified
to check for GB.

Change-Id: I0610047ee2bddefe0ccb46568c0f48de4c0941af
'}]
commit_message:
Fix VMwareVCdriver reporting incorrect stats

fix bug #1180779

VMware nova compute drivers VMwareESXDriver and VMwareVCDriver
currently report stats for the column local_gb in MB instead of in GB
The fix would be to modify vmwareapi/host.py to ensure the values
reported for disk space are calculated in GB instead of MB.
Fix is done by further dividing the existing MB value by 1024 to
convert to GB.
The unit tests to check for capacity and freespace have been modified
to check for GB.

Change-Id: I0610047ee2bddefe0ccb46568c0f48de4c0941af

commit_message:
Clarify instance_type vs flavor in nova-manage

Make it clear that we are only using the term flavor now.

Partially implements bp flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: Ic26349d70fd99a20635f3ae45041c66b300a0513

Dear reviewers:

I'd like to explain that I had done another kind of UT which I can't write the test case in test_exception.py to check unicode support.Because it need deploy special mo file which contain unicode translation.Here are my test steps:
1,Captured Unauthorized message "The request you have made requires authentication." into pot/po file
2,Add Chinese translation "??????" for it and convert the po file into mo file
3,Deploy the mo file into default locale dir /usr/share/locale
4,Wrote a temporary test case to test mo file unicode message support

def test_unicode_message_get_from_mo(self):
        self.opt(debug=True)

        risky_info = u'\u7ee7\u7eed\u884c\u7f29\u8fdb\u6216'
        e = exception.Unauthorized()
        self.assertValidJsonRendering(e)
        self.assertIn(risky_info, e.message)

It can sucessfully run. So I believe the new exception.py can work against unicode translation.
For unicode argument support, I add a new test case test_unicode_argument_message'}, {'account_id': 7138, 'date': '2013-05-31 08:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Gerrit doesn't support Chinese in review message, so the

I'd like to explain why I add "from keystone.openstack.common.gettextutils import _" in exception.py in my patch 2:
1,gettext.install('keystone', unicode=1) was removed from config.py, _ function can't be recognized without "from keystone.openstack.common.gettextutils import _"
2,same code line in keystone.openstack.common.policy.py
3,it can pass pep8 checking in my local dev env

According to #2 and #3, I don't know why Jenkins failure cause by the code.
According to #1,in my patch 3,I have added "gettextutils.install('keystone')" in exception.py.

"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-24 19:49:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

See inline. If no file in nova explicitly needs to import _, I am not sure why anything in keystone would need to either."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-06-24 21:25:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: (1 inline comment)

Joe - this is the first time keystone will be doing string translations at module import time (see the exception class definitions). It's the first time the _() function will need to be defined before keystone.exception is imported

Nova has a similar situation, but it ensures that _() is defined by calling gettext.install() in nova/cmd/__init__.py

Keystone delays calling gettext.install() until after the module imports has happened, so it is using the _() function from gettextutils rather than relying on the builtin installed by gettext.install()

Both are actually perfectly valid approaches"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-24 22:20:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: No score

Mark, I see now.  What is the benefit of delaying 'gettext.install()'  Wouldn't moving that earlier be a better way to address this, as it will cover any other cases of this (translation at import time)?"}, {'account_id': 7138, 'date': '2013-06-25 05:11:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Mark has pointed out the reason of using "from keystone.
openstack.common.gettextutils import _" in exception module.
And it's a valid approach, so the Jenkins shouldn't raise
error against the code line.
The issue still exist and block the code review,I'll reopen
the bug 1186188'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-06-25 05:45:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Joe - on balance, I think I prefer doing the gettext.install() early but it's pretty darn nasty too. Say if you wanted to do e.g. import the module and list its contents from a python shell, you need to run gettext.install() first. See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/28531/1/bin/keystone-all"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-06-25 17:42:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Mark, makes sense

David, This hasn't been fixed in hacking because we have made the next release of hacking.  In the interim I recommend disabling the check. 

Going forward we can either make another bug fix release (and branch) for 0.5.6 which would just have the noqa fix, or we can wait for some more bug fixes and new checks to land and release version 0.6.  Which do you prefer?"}, {'account_id': 7138, 'date': '2013-06-26 03:51:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Implement exception module i18n support

The doc string in exception.py of Keystone will be
returned with __doc__ method, but cannot realize the
internationalization.Change exception module to enable
i18n support.

Changes in the patch are:
1, useing class variable msg_fmt to replace class __doc__
2, modify wsgi.render_exception function using unicode
function to replace str function
3, modify/add UT test cases

Fixes: bug # 1179425

Change-Id: I75c1229c905a2625d2f6961d1a8dd3958eac51a5

[{'created': '2013-05-18 19:35:10.000000000', 'message': 'Clear cached engine when global engine changes

The keystone.common.sql.core.Base class cached the global database
engine when get_session() was called. When the global database engine
changed to a new instance, the cached copy was used in subsequent
calls to get_session(), leading to using the old engine and tests
failing to run by themselves.

This change makes it so that when the global database engine is
changed, Base will use the new engine rather than the invalid one.

Change-Id: I75aa3c230d9b4fd666ab8d478c9e9a27669905e8
Fixes: Bug #1179259

commit_message:
Clear cached engine when global engine changes

The keystone.common.sql.core.Base class cached the global database
engine when get_session() was called. When the global database engine
changed to a new instance, the cached copy was used in subsequent
calls to get_session(), leading to using the old engine and tests
failing to run by themselves.

This change makes it so that when the global database engine is
changed, Base will use the new engine rather than the invalid one.

Change-Id: I75aa3c230d9b4fd666ab8d478c9e9a27669905e8
Fixes: Bug #1179259

commit_message:
Encode error messages before sending them to stdout

When an error with non-ascii characters is caught by glanceclient, it
fails at printing it and exists with a UnicodeEncodedError. This patch
encodes errors' messages using strutils before sending them to stdout.

Fixes bug: #1200206

Change-Id: I4dabcd76ffb258840bd6a66ad23c030f34960e86

commit_message:
Configure horizon and horizon URLs in Tempest

Tempest now supports testing the dashboard. Adjust the configuration
accordingly.

'}, {'account_id': 860, 'date': '2013-07-24 17:38:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Good spot -- you save an unnecessary GET request. I had to add tracing to figure out how it managed to give back the right content even though _error_response() was always called!

However, I notice that the handle_object() function also checks for is_redirection() in a similar situation.

I think the test should have been:

    elif not is_success(self._get_status_int()) and \
        not is_redirection(self._get_status_int()):


ie., change "or" to "and".

I don't know why a GET of ../index.html could return 3xx -- but it's something the original developer expected. Maybe it's to allow something later in the pipeline?? Either way, if you remove is_redirection() from handle_container(), I might expect the same in handle_object()/'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2013-07-25 01:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2013-07-25 02:16:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Donagh McCabe:


I don't know the reason for returning 3xx either.
So I choose to keep the original developer's expectation(test of is_redirection) in agreement with your comment.Thanks."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-25 02:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-24 06:53:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect status handling at staticweb

Staticweb middleware always searchs html
for error response when response status code
is not redirect.
It causes swift to return error response
even if the request succeeded.
(e.g. When finding index.html with 200,
      staticweb returns 200error.html
      if it exist)

This patch modifies the constraint on response
status and fix bug 1204319.

Fixes bug #1204319.

Change-Id: Ib83c303917da7fb94999f2d4d35063b450d0e992
'}, {'created': '2013-07-24 07:46:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect status handling at staticweb

Staticweb middleware always searchs html
for error response when response status code
is not redirect.
It causes swift to return error response
even if the request succeeded.
(e.g. When finding index.html with 200,
      staticweb returns 200error.html
      if it exist)

This patch modifies the constraint on response
status and fix bug 1204319.

Fixes bug #1204319.

Change-Id: Ib83c303917da7fb94999f2d4d35063b450d0e992
'}, {'created': '2013-07-25 01:46:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect status handling at staticweb

Staticweb middleware always searchs html
for error response when response status code
is not redirect.
It causes swift to return error response
even if the request succeeded.
(e.g. When finding index.html with 200,
      staticweb returns 200error.html
      if it exist)

This patch modifies the constraint on response
status and fix bug 1204319.

Fixes bug #1204319.

Change-Id: Ib83c303917da7fb94999f2d4d35063b450d0e992
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect status handling at staticweb

Staticweb middleware always searchs html
for error response when response status code
is not redirect.
It causes swift to return error response
even if the request succeeded.
(e.g. When finding index.html with 200,
      staticweb returns 200error.html
      if it exist)

This patch modifies the constraint on response
status and fix bug 1204319.

Fixes bug #1204319.

Change-Id: Ib83c303917da7fb94999f2d4d35063b450d0e992

commit_message:
Allow floating point value for dispersion_coverage

For systems with very large numbers of partitions, 1% dispersion
coverage may simply be too much/take too long. This fix allows <1
values to be used for dispersion_coverage.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I5ed35b69754d55a410e66e658b3854de57c7666b

commit_message:
fix sql_connection string used in linuxbridge config

Previously the value ended up being "sqlite://".

Also added some tests and when adding the tests discovered that the
quantum-server has to be defined in the same recipe.

Change-Id: Icf765e25365f943be13543e97fb9f7c136f6810d

[{'created': '2013-07-27 05:03:57.000000000', 'message': 'Skipping test_stamp_pattern

The test case is failing because the partition does not becomes
 visible on the guest system even after a wait.
According to the syslog the "iSCSI Initiator over TCP/IP" is attached on the host,
 but does not visible on the guest.

The issue cannot be fixed on tempest side.

Change-Id: I587eacf83ade45035286e5a3cb9330366457cba8
'}, {'created': '2013-07-27 15:16:42.000000000', 'message': 'Skipping test_stamp_pattern

The test case is failing because the partition does not becomes
 visible on the guest system even after a longer wait.
According to the syslog the "iSCSI Initiator over TCP/IP" is attached on the host,
 but it does not visible on the guest system.

The issue cannot be fixed on tempest side.

Change-Id: I587eacf83ade45035286e5a3cb9330366457cba8
'}]
commit_message:
Skipping test_stamp_pattern

The test case is failing because the partition does not becomes
 visible on the guest system even after a longer wait.
According to the syslog the "iSCSI Initiator over TCP/IP" is attached on the host,
 but it does not visible on the guest system.

The issue cannot be fixed on tempest side.

Change-Id: I587eacf83ade45035286e5a3cb9330366457cba8

This fixes and gates on H232.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-26 16:41:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix hostname conflict in config generator

When the system hostname is the same as a default value in the
config, the _sanitize_default function may replace it incorrectly.
This change checks that the name of the option contains the
substring 'host' to make sure it isn't changing non-hostname
defaults.

Fixes bug 1205411

Change-Id: I93edb2902304c5cd9bfa817b1bccdaec5d807e6c
"}]
commit_message:
Fix hostname conflict in config generator

When the system hostname is the same as a default value in the
config, the _sanitize_default function may replace it incorrectly.
This change checks that the name of the option contains the
substring 'host' to make sure it isn't changing non-hostname
defaults.

Fixes bug 1205411

Change-Id: I93edb2902304c5cd9bfa817b1bccdaec5d807e6c

commit_message:
Remove --silient-upload option, which is invalid

Python-glanceclient removed the --silent-upload some time ago (I
believe when the client was split out from Glance itself).  It's no
longer valid and needs to be removed.  Otherwise users will see
an error of the form:

glance: error: unrecognized arguments: --silent-upload

Change-Id: I417688872bd8e7c4bac7be13d0b0eb13a030fe29

commit_message:
feat(transport): no longer support get single msg

This change makes the method more consistent: multiple-id in,
multiple-message out.

Change-Id: I2a7ced77fa22962bbbf0c0e35f1ad61470d0a73c

commit_message:
Move legacy read_config into collect_config

This way we only have one place where config files are read and parsed.

Change-Id: Ibde4ab54c6f2f8ba092653447fe06a03a9594c00

commit_message:
Add lbaas support for Openstack Network (Neutron).

* Add support of quantum lbaas.
* Add rspec tests for balancer recipe.
* Add reference stranerfile for ci.

Change-Id: I9f783ffa8056e2eaa09a6f48b9bc863f578ed9ce

commit_message:
Force reopening eventlet's hub after fork

With this we reopen eventlet's hub after a fork (triggered from
websockify when a new client connects) to prevent sharing epoll's fd
with the parent, which may cause erratic behaviour.

This caused novncproxy/spicehtml5proxy to stop working when it had more
than two clients connected.

Fixes bug #1193031

Change-Id: I3ff9001543b84b1037597da243422490bb611657

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-17 16:47:28.000000000', 'message': 'eventlet.monkey_patch() for spice and vnc proxy

The spice and VNC proxy apps did not run eventlet.monkey_patch(). These
services use rpc to talk to nova-consoleauth, so eventlet is required.

Note that this is a stable/grizzly patch only. The issue does not

commit_message:
eventlet.monkey_patch() for spice and vnc proxy

The VNC proxy and spice apps did not run eventlet.monkey_patch(). These
services uses rpc to talk to nova-consoleauth, so eventlet is required.

Note that this is a stable/grizzly patch only. The issue does not
affect master (havana) anymore as it was resolved as a side effect of
switching everything in bin/ over to using entry points. The monkey
patching is done in nova/cmd/__init__.py now.

Change-Id: I61cb1212d283e41e6fda88a9521a9e54143af1fb

commit_message:
use chef package for kernel headers

Previously we used a bash block and a direct apt-get
install which would not properly pass package overrides
causing chef to halt on apt-get when dist config files
had been modified

Change-Id: I82a691c81f71dd7b5b56745282160c703a0f60a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-18 16:09:36.000000000', 'message': "Update instance.node on evacuate

The evacuate API works like a migration from a dead node. As part of
migration, the instance.node property is updated to reflect the target
node that the instance is migrating to. This is later used when the
migration is confirmed/reverted. The problem is when an instance is
being evacuated, the node property isn't getting updated and the
instance will have the old (dead) node value set on it after it's
evacuated. This patch updates instance.node when the instance is
evacuated.

Fixes bug 1198284

Change-Id: I4901fb937160e955df7c97c37265783e844fdbef
(cherry picked from commit 3da3dfb733237ed2c908d8770961d8d6656ea1a3)
"}]
commit_message:
Update instance.node on evacuate

The evacuate API works like a migration from a dead node. As part of
migration, the instance.node property is updated to reflect the target
node that the instance is migrating to. This is later used when the
migration is confirmed/reverted. The problem is when an instance is
being evacuated, the node property isn't getting updated and the
instance will have the old (dead) node value set on it after it's
evacuated. This patch updates instance.node when the instance is
evacuated.

Fixes bug 1198284

Change-Id: I4901fb937160e955df7c97c37265783e844fdbef
(cherry picked from commit 3da3dfb733237ed2c908d8770961d8d6656ea1a3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-12 18:54:02.000000000', 'message': 'Make resize/migrated shared storage aware

Fixes bug 1177247 (for stable/grizzly)

Added some logic to check for whether or not we are on a shared
filesystem and set shared_storage accordingly. We perform similar
checks in other areas of the code, typically through RPC calls.
However, all the resize/migrate code is slated to be refactored for
Hava, so the idea was to keep this patch as minimally intrusive as
possible.

When shared_storage is true, we pass that on to the cleanup call
so that it no longer executes an rm via SSH, which was ultimately
destroying the original instance directory.

Change-Id: Ie9decedd373c000211c171df64e1e96fe78e5081
Cherry-Pick: 9290bddd9f270d8ea4fbd6d953a8634473979cd5
'}]
commit_message:
Make resize/migrated shared storage aware

Fixes bug 1177247 (for stable/grizzly)

Added some logic to check for whether or not we are on a shared
filesystem and set shared_storage accordingly. We perform similar
checks in other areas of the code, typically through RPC calls.
However, all the resize/migrate code is slated to be refactored for
Hava, so the idea was to keep this patch as minimally intrusive as
possible.

When shared_storage is true, we pass that on to the cleanup call
so that it no longer executes an rm via SSH, which was ultimately
destroying the original instance directory.

Change-Id: Ie9decedd373c000211c171df64e1e96fe78e5081
Cherry-Pick: 9290bddd9f270d8ea4fbd6d953a8634473979cd5

https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/common/middleware/tempauth.py#L93"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-06-29 00:24:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Needs some meaningful error reporting for bogus regexes, IMHO. The exception thrown by re.compile isn't particularly helpful; print out the bogus one so at least the user has a chance of figuring things out."}, {'account_id': 794, 'date': '2013-07-01 14:32:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Clay, I'll check that out. I was looking for a better way but wasn't sure.

Samuel, I don't agree with that. This is isn't like checking if a phone number has the proper amount of digits and proper format. One should be aware of how their own gear work on the storage node and if not using regular device block names than one should make sure they come up with a proper regex that fits their needs. If they don't know what they are doing and use a regex without testing than the utility just won't work. That's nothing different than what already happens on some distros where the utility can be setup for running on the cron but is not actually picking up drive failures either because the system doesn't use kern.log or the systems is using something else for the device blocks like cXuX or dm-X devices."}, {'account_id': 794, 'date': '2013-07-02 23:13:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-03 00:11:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Well, I think the patch I offered subttly changed the behavior wrt the default regex's - I think the copy in the sample config is no longer consistent with the behavior.  I don't *really* care which way you go, but the verbiage should be correct before merge.

Hrmm.. I guess the commit message also suggests that the purpose was to extend, not modify/replace the two default regexes :\

commit_message:
Configuration options for error regex and log file in the config now

Making it possible for one to overwrite the default set of regexes
used to search for device block errors in the log file. Also making
the log file naming pattern configurable by setting them in the
drive-audit.conf file.

Updating "Detecting Failed Drives" section on the admin guide as well.

Change-Id: I7bd3acffed196da3e09db4c9dcbb48a20bdd1cf0

commit_message:
Don't pass empty image to filter on live migration

If live migration for a volume backed instance without an image supplied
is initiated with no destination supplied, image is set to None.

This value will cause one of the default filters - the
ImagePropertiesFilter to throw an exception in it's host_passes method,
as it expects an image to be a dictionary.

We solve this by leaving out the image entirely before engaging filters.

This patch is intended for stable/grizzly only, since live migration
functionality is being heavily refactored in Havana at the moment and
the code from the patch that introduces this bug
(Ie683a3ca5d6430c52ead77b41f98fbcb4114ea1e) was
accidentally dropped in I6de33ada6dc377e20f8df07da92244f2c150b9fe.

Fixes bug: 1199811

Change-Id: I8a5f1b176addbe09c8d8b5f1d1136d05af53ce3e

[{'created': '2013-07-17 09:12:25.000000000', 'message': 'Use default cidr to avoid exception when editing quantum security rules.

$ quantum security-group-rule-create --direction ingress --protocol TCP
--port-range-min 80 --port-range-max 80 web

After creating security group rule with command above, An exception is thrown
when editing the rules for groups web.

Fixes: bug #1165095

Change-Id: If32992622ebc20559dde911455b241937eb59ae6
(cherry picked from commit 706560f6d230334d645ce97301631baaa5c56095)
'}]
commit_message:
Use default cidr to avoid exception when editing quantum security rules.

$ quantum security-group-rule-create --direction ingress --protocol TCP
--port-range-min 80 --port-range-max 80 web

After creating security group rule with command above, An exception is thrown
when editing the rules for groups web.

Fixes: bug #1165095

Change-Id: If32992622ebc20559dde911455b241937eb59ae6
(cherry picked from commit 706560f6d230334d645ce97301631baaa5c56095)

commit_message:
feat(storage): separate queue set_metadata()

This patch also removes the precondition checking from the
storage DriverBase class; input validation will be implemented
separately.

Change-Id: I674e6b633c3959e6a0753fcc3a36332e84a5b1ef
Implements: blueprint metadata-resource

- http://logs.openstack.org/37487/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/19005 : SUCCESS in 22m 07s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-07-17 15:56:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

I see updates to the test suite, but no specific tests on the functionality you're adding.  Also, I don't see how this patch addresses the bug that was reported; that bug seems to be talking about how we're doing the filtering on the client side, but the patch seems to preserve that same filtering."}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-07-17 16:23:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Kevin: I just fixed the existing tests to work with the modified findall method (there are now some /resource calls and less /resource/details calls). Do we really need more tests? The behavior of findall is the same like before. It's correct that the patch doesn't fix the issue to receive a list of all resources. But I think there is no way to resolve the ID of a resource by the name using the Nova API. At least I found no documented method. To really resolve the issue we need methods in the API to resolve the IDs. The patch reduces the overhead to resolve the ID of a resource by the name. It only fetches a list of all names and IDs and afterwards it fetches the details of a resource. At the moment we fetch the details of all resources every time. That's a lot of overhead when calling (for example) "nova show INSTANCE" and you've 500 instances running.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-07-17 16:28:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

Commented inside.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-07-17 16:40:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2013-07-17 16:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Extended the commit message, removed the parentheses, re-added the notes that find and findall are filtering on Python side.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-17 17:34:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

commit_message:
make findall in novaclient/base.py more efficient

Use /resources instead of /resources/detail to resolve
the resource ID by the name and load the details of the
resource in a separate step. This reduces the overhead
to resolve the resource ID and results in a better runtime
performance.

This patch does not solve the issue that the name resolving
takes place on the client side. For solving this issue new
Nova API methods are necessary.

fixes bug #1202179

Change-Id: Ib753b1d090cb74b2d137c68f6899dad4ae2ec1ca

commit_message:
Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: I59c6268637dea8ca06cdb8bf28808d1b59562ff7

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-07-14 14:49:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/36979/1/check/gate-swift-pep8/3081 : SUCCESS in 56s
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/36979/1/check/gate-swift-docs/2911/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 1m 16s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36979/1/check/gate-swift-python26/3154 : SUCCESS in 3m 21s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36979/1/check/gate-swift-python27/3157 : SUCCESS in 1m 48s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36979/1/check/gate-swift-devstack-vm-functional/6 : FAILURE in 7m 36s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/36979/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/31956 : SUCCESS in 43m 33s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36979/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cells-full/122 : FAILURE in 14m 03s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/36979/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-neutron/3393 : SUCCESS in 17m 31s (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/36979/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/31648 : SUCCESS in 44m 52s
- http://logs.openstack.org/36979/1/check/gate-grenade-devstack-vm/17920 : FAILURE in 17m 11s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-07-14 19:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The original reason for making the versioned writes feature default to "off" is because it allows existing production clusters (at the time of writing) to upgrade and choose when and how to enable this feature.

Actually, I'd love for versioned writes to be enabled by default, but I do not think it being used by devstack is sufficient justification for doing so. I think we'd also need to have a clear desire from the core devs to change the default, and we'd need to have existing deployments (at all scales) running it.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-15 07:28:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the explanation.  
It makes sense.

What do you think, how much time is required for making a an 'old' feature as default ?

Does the allow_versions has any negative side effect ?"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-07-15 17:51:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I'd like it to be on by default.  I think not making a choice to use a cool swift feature should result in you *getting* that feature.

For new features I think a one cycle release default to off should be sufficient.  Surely versions qualifies, while like thread_pool might not yet?"}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2013-07-22 21:01:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

will discuss at the next swift meeting'}, {'account_id': 917, 'date': '2013-07-22 21:50:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If the purpose is to use this feature in devstack, why not just enable it in the devstack configs?"}, {'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-07-22 21:53:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think the question is not much about devstack (since it's already enabled there: https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/blob/master/lib/swift#L253) but if we want to advise to use allow_versions=true by default in our config files."}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-07-24 19:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

An admin should be aware of this feature being turned on and understand the fact that it will eat up his storage capacity if he uses the cluster in certain ways. 

It is best to leave this feature disabled and allow only a user that is aware of the consequences to enable it'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-07-24 19:22:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-07-29 05:32:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

As I said in the IRC meeting, I don't think default values should change on deployers.  If defaults can change, we might as well make every setting required in the conf files and not even have defaults... because that's what every deployer would end up having to do anyway to avoid having to worry about an optional, defaulted-off feature suddenly turning defaulted-on."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-07-29 16:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-14 14:04:56.000000000', 'message': 'allow_versions default true

allow_versions set to true by devstack since long.
The versions are tested by tempest as well,
so it should be the default value.

DocImapct

Change-Id: I881ab173b6a336f2b09bd58bd1deba5ca8eabba4
'}]
commit_message:
allow_versions default true

allow_versions set to true by devstack since long.
The versions are tested by tempest as well,
so it should be the default value.

DocImapct

Change-Id: I881ab173b6a336f2b09bd58bd1deba5ca8eabba4

commit_message:
Add availability-zone-list command

This is client-side support for the os-availability-zone extension added in
https://review.openstack.org/34813.  As /os-availability-zone/detail is not
yet implemented, adjustments were made to accomodate the lack of hosts
in the returned zone list.

Added for both v1 and v2, basically a copy of the equivalent novaclient command.

Change-Id: Iae806a2b5ea3a2d3c984a138d9c27e169160766e

[{'created': '2013-07-28 19:08:22.000000000', 'message': "Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: I7cd33f95b7baa22dbd4abb6e391ee59876998f59
"}]
commit_message:
Update references with new Mailing List location

Yesterday, openstack@lists.launchpad.org was migrated with
all users to openstack@list.openstack.org.

This patch updates references to the old mailing list with the
new, to ensure that people encountering them don't accidentally
try and join the old list!

Change-Id: I7cd33f95b7baa22dbd4abb6e391ee59876998f59

Hyper-V 2012 introduced live migration support and a WMI namespace that

features.

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V issues on versions prior to 2012

Fixes bug: #1203059

Hyper-V 2012 introduced live migration support and a WMI namespace that
can be used to handle iSCSI targets.

The Hyper-V driver was not properly recognizing versions of the os prior to
2012 causing an exception during startup due to the usage of unsupported
features.

Unit tests have been added to test the behaviour of the driver with
different os versions.

Change-Id: Ie2c2ba6c9aee1ea634c79ca3391c96fe42db341a

commit_message:
Sync lockutils from Oslo

90b6a65 Fix locking bug
27d4b41 Move synchronized body to a first-class function
15c17fb Make lock_file_prefix optional
1a2df89 Enable H302 hacking check
b41862d Use param keyword for docstrings

Fixes bug 1065531
And bug 1162047

Change-Id: Ide79292fae6f779ecd4ac166d68c8f10ca728409

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-25 15:56:10.000000000', 'message': "Allow insecure=True to be set in swiftclient

Currently when we instantiate a swiftclient.Connection we can't pass in
the insecure keyword arg. This means environments which have self-signed
certs might have trouble talking to auth/swift. This fixes that
situation and allows SSL certs to be ignored.

Change-Id: I9663ed333e93529beba4a0736d3b9207bd4f150d
"}]
commit_message:
Allow insecure=True to be set in swiftclient

Currently when we instantiate a swiftclient.Connection we can't pass in
the insecure keyword arg. This means environments which have self-signed
certs might have trouble talking to auth/swift. This fixes that
situation and allows SSL certs to be ignored.

Change-Id: I9663ed333e93529beba4a0736d3b9207bd4f150d

commit_message:
Move Keystone config to main designate config

The keystone middleware can be configured using the main designate
config file. This allows the api-paste config file to be left as is
by most designate users.

Bug #1206091

Change-Id: I6b0be7dbdecdecd5579b3024b59d8a070205fc1e

Nova's native exception (VolumeNotFound).
2. Added unit test coverage.

Change-Id: I3cee31a9fd068b65a4097f3f3054aebb69d9ba61
(cherry picked from commit 921eec91abee56ea69e1b8b2bff59379b68bff87)

commit_message:
Fixed deleting instance booted from invalid vol

1. Translated the exception (NotFound) raised from Cinder client to
Nova's native exception (VolumeNotFound).
2. Added unit test coverage.

Fixes LP: #1087214.

Change-Id: I3cee31a9fd068b65a4097f3f3054aebb69d9ba61
(cherry picked from commit 921eec91abee56ea69e1b8b2bff59379b68bff87)

[{'created': '2013-07-26 15:39:57.000000000', 'message': 'Update python-heatclient dependency

currently horizon requires
python-keystoneclient>=0.3.0
python-heatclient>=0.2.2

but python-heatclient-0.2.2 requires python-keystoneclient>=0.2,<0.3

as a result, setuptools will fail to install horizon if python-heatclient-0.2.2 is installed

changing python-heatclient minimal version to 0.2.3 can solve the issue,
as python-heatclient-0.2.3 requires python-keystoneclient>=0.3.0

Change-Id: Id5dc6bb4514ebb98496ae08aa633c0b71d886f3f
Fixes: bug #1199529
'}, {'created': '2013-07-29 09:36:15.000000000', 'message': 'Update python-heatclient dependency

currently horizon requires
python-keystoneclient>=0.3.0
python-heatclient>=0.2.2

but python-heatclient-0.2.2 requires python-keystoneclient>=0.2,<0.3

as a result, setuptools will fail to install horizon if python-heatclient-0.2.2 is installed

changing python-heatclient minimal version to 0.2.3 can solve the issue,
as python-heatclient-0.2.3 requires python-keystoneclient>=0.3.0

Change-Id: Id5dc6bb4514ebb98496ae08aa633c0b71d886f3f
Fixes: bug #1199529
'}, {'created': '2013-07-29 12:14:24.000000000', 'message': 'Update heat and ceilometer clients requirements

Current minimal versions of python-keystoneclient and python-ceilometerclient
require an incompatible version of python-keystoneclient (>=0.2,<0.3)

As a result, setuptools will fail to install horizon if python-heatclient-0.2.2
and/or python-ceilometerclient-1.0.1 are installed

This patch updates the mimimal versions of these client to make sure they have a
compatible requirement of python-keystoneclient (>=0.3.0)

Change-Id: Id5dc6bb4514ebb98496ae08aa633c0b71d886f3f
Fixes: bug #1199529
'}]
commit_message:
Update heat and ceilometer clients requirements

Current minimal versions of python-keystoneclient and python-ceilometerclient
require an incompatible version of python-keystoneclient (>=0.2,<0.3)

As a result, setuptools will fail to install horizon if python-heatclient-0.2.2
and/or python-ceilometerclient-1.0.1 are installed

This patch updates the mimimal versions of these client to make sure they have a
compatible requirement of python-keystoneclient (>=0.3.0)

Change-Id: Id5dc6bb4514ebb98496ae08aa633c0b71d886f3f
Fixes: bug #1199529

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 11:51:22.000000000', 'message': 'Move "opportunistic" db migrations tests from Nova

For db migrations tests on Jenkins we must use
hardcoded credentials and skip test if backend
(mysql or postgres) not available on developer
host.
Patch moves this "opportunistic" tests from Nova.

blueprint db-migration-tests-opportunistic

Change-Id: I3bd0be61a00916507f02a86a2e45c5831b3aaa5f
'}]
commit_message:
Move "opportunistic" db migrations tests from Nova

For db migrations tests on Jenkins we must use
hardcoded credentials and skip test if backend
(mysql or postgres) not available on developer
host.
Patch moves this "opportunistic" tests from Nova.

blueprint db-migration-tests-opportunistic

Change-Id: I3bd0be61a00916507f02a86a2e45c5831b3aaa5f

Postgresql is kind of sensitive about different kind of data in a query, so it
was failing in cases like looking for an ip using a filter which wasn't a valid
ip or ids values greater than the id type on the table.

This patch fix this behavior to fixed ips in API-v3.
In v2 this was fixed by change I83d532c28c9aec690e8e1ffad8b58e71d619d728

Change-Id: I9aa14bea2f29f1df85dfd1f07eb0b1947d2c1100

Postgresql is kind of sensitive about different kind of data in a query, so it
was failing in cases like looking for an ip using a filter which wasn't a valid
ip or ids values greater than the id type on the table.

This patch fix this behavior to fixed ips in API-v3.
In v2 this was fixed by change I83d532c28c9aec690e8e1ffad8b58e71d619d728

Fixes bug 1182754
Fixes bug 1204503

Change-Id: I9aa14bea2f29f1df85dfd1f07eb0b1947d2c1100

commit_message:
Fix postgresql failures related to Data type to API-v3 fixed-ip

Postgresql is kind of sensitive about different kind of data in a query, so it
was failing in cases like looking for an ip using a filter which wasn't a valid
ip or ids values greater than the id type on the table.

This patch fix this behavior to fixed ips in API-v3.
In v2 this was fixed by change I83d532c28c9aec690e8e1ffad8b58e71d619d728

Fixes bug 1182754
Fixes bug 1204503

Change-Id: I9aa14bea2f29f1df85dfd1f07eb0b1947d2c1100

commit_message:
Add column "Uptime" to instances overview

Add column "Uptime" to instances overview
in project and admin panels. Add "Created"
and "Uptime" to instance details view.

fixes bug 1202889

Change-Id: I84559da6ca9ed750a9073dbb6203b49932df34fc

[{'created': '2013-07-26 19:13:39.000000000', 'message': "fix race condition in service list compares

there is a small chance that between the 2 service queries that
the service list is updated by the periodic job. We'll assume
stability of the service host list in the regular case, but
the other metadata is changeable, so only compary the binary
lists.

Fixes bug #1205450

Change-Id: I29f687d4279b79f192de3bae3d15abebd3d858a1
"}]
commit_message:
fix race condition in service list compares

there is a small chance that between the 2 service queries that
the service list is updated by the periodic job. We'll assume
stability of the service host list in the regular case, but
the other metadata is changeable, so only compary the binary
lists.

Fixes bug #1205450

Change-Id: I29f687d4279b79f192de3bae3d15abebd3d858a1

[{'created': '2013-07-26 19:28:11.000000000', 'message': "Set lock_path for Tempest to TMPDIR

Tempest change I5376f977a110f502f0e4958cbccbd379539e006b syncs
lockutils from oslo. Tempest with testr needs to use external locks
which require a lock_path config option. This commit sets that option
for tempest to use devstack's TMPDIR.

Change-Id: I464edf9e11710e1931ed4f7b0262328a57e5b3de
"}]
commit_message:
Set lock_path for Tempest to TMPDIR

Tempest change I5376f977a110f502f0e4958cbccbd379539e006b syncs
lockutils from oslo. Tempest with testr needs to use external locks
which require a lock_path config option. This commit sets that option
for tempest to use devstack's TMPDIR.

Change-Id: I464edf9e11710e1931ed4f7b0262328a57e5b3de
